                                                                                       James Aronson - Mike
                                                                                       Michael Jayson - Coma
                                                                                      Brian Mckenna - Albie
                                                                                       Joe Lovett - Barry
story_txt:
Synopsis

                                              Elegante’…A mostly
true story
  Vincent
Avigone is twenty-three years old, lives in Brooklyn N.Y. and works as the
“pasta guy” in his family’s Italian restaurant. He works there with his four
uncles...Uncle Johnny, Uncle Ray, Uncle Mike and Uncle Unc. His entire family
including his mother Marie, Aunts Annmarie, Maryanne and Antionette live within
three blocks of each other in the same neighborhood in Brooklyn. Vincent
doesn’t know exactly how he feels about the direction in which he sees his life
heading. It’s nothing he can quite put his finger on but, he thinks there must
be something different, something other than the world in which he lives.
Marcy
Slotnick is a Jewish girl from Long Island who with her family, happens on one
particular Mother’s Day in 1991 to patronize Vincent’s family’s restaurant. Marcy
is a no non-sense girl who knows exactly who she is and where she’s going.
She’s a strong, independent young woman who’s looking forward to graduating with
a degree in speech-language pathology. Marcy has her whole life ahead of her
and everything is going according to plan...until that one particular Sunday in
May...when she meets Vincent.
What follows
is a sweet, funny, touching story of two people from different worlds, whose
obstacles, including family pressures and cultural differences draw them into
an unlikely love story. A love story with some pretty rough edges at
times...this is Brooklyn remember.
Allow
yourself for a few moments to be taken to a small family trattoria in Brooklyn
circa 1991. Enjoy the sounds of a bustling restaurant; the loud voices coming
from the kitchen mixed with the even louder ones across the kitchen table of a
Jewish household in Bellmore Long Island. Be a fly on the wall and enjoy
witnessing what happens when a strong willed Jewish Princess meets a sweet,
unsure of himself Italian boy next door. There’s a place just up the street and
around the corner where all are welcome...all are family. It’s a place called
Elegante’.



WHERE
YOUR DONATIONS GO
I have BIG plans for this show. I'm not looking
for this to be a one time, month long run. I intend this to be just the first run
in many that will take the show from off Broadway, to Broadway, to the Tony
Awards, to television, the movies, action figures and beyond. Well maybe not
action figures. I believe in this play and the story it tells enough to think
it appeals to a very wide audience and can be enjoyed for years to come. With
this in mind I intend on making this first run of Broadway quality in terms of
the sets, lighting, talent, etc. The following is a list of items we need to
make this show all it can be.
1. A GREAT THEATER:
I'm
planning on approximately a 100 seat house. This is big enough to give us off-Broadway
status yet intimate enough to convey the feeling of a nice family restaurant in
Brooklyn.
2. SETS:
The
show takes place mostly in the kitchen, dining room and bar of the restaurant.
I intend to build a full bar and working kitchen-counter with various food
prep stations. Both of these scenery pieces will be on wheels, making them
easier to move on and off the stage. Other set pieces such as Marcy's bed, both
families’ kitchen tables, nightclub set, and additional set pieces will be needed.
3. PROJECTION SCREEN:  
The
most impressive and significant part of the set will be a large projection
screen on the back wall of the stage. This screen will act as the background
for each scene. For instance, the scene inside the restaurant will include live
footage that has been previously recorded at an Italian restaurant rolling as
the background.  During the scenes, the actors
and set pieces will be in the foreground while the video of restaurant patrons
will be seen in the background, giving those scenes a more realistic look. This
feature is unique, original, and promises to be very exciting… it's going to be
awesome!
4. EQUITY STATUS:  
The
plan for this production is that it carry an Off-Broadway equity status which
will help give the production more legitimacy. That necessitates salaries for
cast/crew for each rehearsal and performance.
5. PUBLICIST:
In
order for this show to get the exposure it deserves, it will need the proper
promotion. Elegante is very much a New York story and in turn, will attract and
appeal to real New Yorkers.  It is our intention to draw the interest of
people who are influential and notable, concerned with promoting authentic New
York theater.
6. PROMOTIONAL
MATERIALS:
Most theatrical
productions will incur promotional expenses. This includes advertising,
playbills, flyers, etc.
7. MUSIC:
Elegante takes place
in 1991. I believe music is the only true time machine we have. The soundtrack
is as important as any character in the play. It sets the tone and moves the
story along. With that in mind, I have carefully chosen specific songs from the
time period for each scene to communicate the story effectively.  This is briefly demonstrated in the music
chosen for our promotional video.  Purchasing the rights to use artists’ music is
a cost.

A
TRUE NEW YORK STORY 
Every character in this play is a real person or
based on a real person. There is a Ray and a Mike and an Unc and Coma; and I
did work with them in a restaurant called Elegante. Marcy and her family are
also real and most of the incidents in the story are true events that took
place. Almost all of the events and situations depicted in the play occurred.  I simply put them to paper. 
Elegante' takes place in Brooklyn and Long Island
New York, 1991. This was a time of big hair, Z Cavariccis, Good Fellas, and neon
colored clothes. Elegante’ illustrates the look and feel of that time. It
represents what it was like living in those areas and working in an Italian
restaurant.  Many people can relate to
the struggles and conflicts within Vincent and Marcys’ families. This multi-dimensional
story will be portrayed true to life. This quality boldly comes across in the
script. One need not be from New York or of Italian or Jewish decent to relate
to these characters or their story... if you have a family or have ever
struggled with love, Elegante' has something for you. 

One Man's Efforts

Up until now, I have had a few
friends help along the way, but I am essentially supporting this project by
myself.  I do not have a team or theatre
group behind me. I am just one man trying to produce and share his work.
Writing Elegante’…a mostly true story was a labor of love. Please help me bring
it to the stage.
Sincerely,
James Aronson

Other Ways You Can Help 
We understand that some people
just can't financially contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help. You
can share this campaign with everyone you know on Social Media; Facebook,
Twitter, and more! Indiegogo has some VERY easy "share tools" for you
to do just that!  
I’m trying to do this all on my
own so, I NEED ALL THE HELP I CAN GET! It is my plan to take this show all the
way to Broadway and beyond. Anything you can do in the way of helping me
achieve this goal would be GREATLY APPRICIATED. 
Thank you,  
James
Aronson
ABOUT THE AUTHOR
James Aronson is a
graduate of the American Musical and Dramatic Academy located in New York City.
Over the years he has appeared in numerous stage productions both in New York
and Long Island as well as a number of independent films and television shows.
James is an actor, writer, musician and has completed works in several
different genres. Along with writing and performing original works as a
musician, he has penned 5 children's books and two graphic novels. Elegante'...
a mostly true story is his first full length play. James considers this work to
be the one closest to his heart as it is the true story of how he and his wife
Marcy met.

Thank You                                                                                         CAST
Marcy Aronson - Co Producer                             Elizabeth Shuldiner - Marcy                       Charlie Loboscio - Videographer                        Chris Simiri               - Vincent
Joe Loboscio - Video Editor                                 Alberta J. Thompson - Vincent's MotherPeter Rodrgiuez - Video Editor                          Toni Pelzman - Marcy's MotherAlane Weissman - Editor/Social Media Dir    Betty Tucker - NannnyChris Tarsi - Location                                             Steven Lanza - RayChris & Toni's Restaurant                                     Rich Bamberger - Unc                                                                                       James Aronson - Mike                                                                                       Michael Jayson - Coma                                                                                      Brian Mckenna - Albie                                                                                       Joe Lovett - Barry

story:
From Shelf to Stage: Adapting a Beloved Book

This October, Tongue in Cheek Theater Productions premieres the romantic comedy, The Inn at Lake Devine, based on the best-selling novel by Elinor Lipman.

The New York Times writes, "in her delightful novel, The Inn at Lake Devine, Elinor Lipman waltzes fearlessly through a minefield of identity politics... intermarriage, ethnic cuisine and Anne Frank are some of the unlikely, loaded subjects of this witty romantic comedy."

With your support, we'll bring this beloved book to life onstage this fall.  Get your tickets now! 

Your Generosity Goes Towards:

  • Costumes for 15 actors: a pair of shoes might cost $25, a complete look $100+
  • Lighting design: gels for the stage lights cost $50
  • Scenic design: the finest IKEA furniture, such as a table, is $250 on up!
  • Compensating everyone involved! (15 actors, 4 designers, director, assistant director, house manager, photographer)
  • Renting 5 weeks of rehearsal space for our large cast & crew: $3,000
And, as our supporter, YOU shine:
  • Your donation is tax-deductible
  • Nearly all of our perks are green (e-delivery) and thus fully-deductible
  • All donors are invited to our opening night party in October
  • You'll receive TIC's annual report at year-end
  • You're a part of making new, thought-provoking theater in NYC!

Who We Are

Ever since producer Jake Lipman read the book, she could see it as a play.  It embodies TIC's mission statement because it grapples with family, faith, and falling in love in a heart-felt yet comedic way.

This world premiere of The Inn at Lake Devine marks Tongue in Cheek Theater Productions' tenth season and 31st production of thought-provoking comedies. Since 2006, TIC has produced 30 thought-provoking comedies in NYC, from Books on Tape in FringeNYC to the Puffin Foundation grant-winning Buffalo Heights in 2014.

Our production team:

  • Adapted and produced by Jake Lipman
  • Based on the novel by Elinor Lipman
  • Directed by Kimberly Faith Hickman
  • Assistant directed by Molly Ballerstein
  • Original music and orchestrations by Philip Rothman
  • Costume design by Lisa Renee Jordan
  • Scenic design by Tyler M. Perry
  • Lighting design by Michael Lounsbery
We're excited to find our phenomenal cast this August; more soon!

Risks & Challenges

In adapting The Inn at Lake Devine, we've sought guidance from industry experts:

  • All 13 (!!!) drafts of the script were reviewed by multiple readers
  • In April, TIC performed a staged reading to gather audience feedback ("Full of life, warmth, and joy!")
  • Novelist Elinor Lipman loves our adaptation
  • Composer and arranger Philip Rothman will enhance the story with music
  • This summer, director Kimberly Faith Hickman, assistant director Molly Ballerstein, and producing artistic director Jake Lipman will assemble a top-notch cast and crew to bring the story to life onstage
With all the talented people involved and your encouragement, we can't wait to bring The Inn at Lake Devine to the stage this fall.

Other Ways You Can Help

Sharing your excitement for The Inn at Lake Devine is free!

  • Like us on Facebook and share our posts
  • Follow us on Twitter and tweet about us
  • Read TIC's blog and chime in
  • Use the IndieGoGo share tools
  • Read the book by Elinor Lipman
  • Ask your book club to make The Inn at Lake Devine its summer read
  • Gather a group to come to a performance (e.g., book clubs, faith-based organizations, and school groups are welcome)

Thank you for being a part of our world premiere! 

How Does Our Tax-Deductible Support Work?

Jake Lipman / Tongue in Cheek Theater Productions is a sponsored artist  with Performance Zone Inc. (DBA The Field), a not-for-profit, tax-exempt, 501(c)(3) organization serving the performing arts community. Contributions made to The Field and earmarked for Jake Lipman/Tongue In Cheek Theater Productions are tax-deductible to the extent allowed by law.

For more information about The Field, contact: The Field, 75 Maiden Lane, Suite 906, New York, NY 10038, (212) 691-6969, fax: (212) 255-2053, www.thefield.org or for our national charities registration, see details. A copy of The Field’s latest annual report may be obtained, upon request, from The Field or from the Office of the Attorney General, Charities Bureau, 120 Broadway, New York, NY 10271.

story:
Help Uncle Buzzy make it back home to Vermont this summer!

Please help Uncle Buzzy get back home to Vermont this July for a rollicking tour through the state, followed by a triumphant return to California!  We are trying to perform in several places, including...

  • June 21st:  The Community Center in Bolinas, California (followed by beers at Smiley's)
  • June 26th:  The Velo Rouge Café in San Francisco
  • NEW!  July 10th: Elderly Services in Middlebury, Vermont! 
  • July 12th: The Town Hall Theater in Middlebury, Vermont (Mike's hometown!)
  • July 15th: The Church in Windham, Vermont (Mike's Mom's hometown at the church where she was married!)
  • July 18th: The Valley Players Theater in Waitsfield, Vermont
  • Aug 1st:  PianoFight Theater in San Francisco
  • Also trying to book two live radio broadcasts, from Pt. Reyes Station, California and the other possibly while in Middlebury, Vermont
  • And trying to book more! (with your support)

CLICK HERE FOR LATEST TOUR DATES & INFO!

Uncle Buzzy is currently based in the San Francisco Bay Area, but we are a looooooong way from home.  We definitely need your support to produce and book these shows, and to cover expenses.  And if we exceed our goal, we'll be able to add-on more shows in the SF Bay Area after our Vermont Tour!  


Who is Uncle Buzzy?


Uncle Buzzy’s Hometown Theater Show was founded in 2004, by Mike Sommers, Lawrence Radecker and Ted Wee, with the mission of performing entertaining, comedic, and musical sketches often with agricultural and environmental themes centering on their friendship.  We're all actors, writers and musicians who have deep roots in varied agricultural communities, ranging from Mike’s upbringing in Middlebury, Vermont; to Lawrence’s childhood in Metairie, Louisiana; to Ted's small town life in Madisonville, Kentucky.  We bonded a strong friendship due to the commonality of our perspectives, and launched our theater show with the goal of attracting attention to the plight of small farmers and creating a greater awareness of our environment.  

Okay, but what is it really?

Uncle Buzzy’s Hometown Theater Show is down-home sketch comedy with grass-fed musical surprises starring your friends and neighbors!  (It’s kinda like Saturday Night Live, plus music with a sense of humor like Flight of the Conchords, all with a hometown country feel like Prairie Home Companion)…and we like to get local people from your town to guest star in the show with us!

Buzzy's material is mainly developed in Mike’s home in West Oakland, CA from conversations that have lasted a decade. These rehearsals are often day-long creative sessions and are infused with friendship, eating and drinking, and lots o' music.  Sometimes, it can be hard-to-tell when we’re creating new material, when we’re rehearsing established material, or when we’re just horsing around.  But these sessions have resulted in several popular sketches, as well as more than a dozen #1 hits!*

*Self-proclaimed

During the past several years, Uncle Buzzy has made progressively larger strides in writing, creating and performing our original musical and sketch comedy vignettes throughout the San Francisco Bay Area.  We've performed at The Exit Theater, Yerba Buena Center for the Arts, The Off-Market Theater, Thick House, Xenodrome, Velo Rouge Café, on the radio at KPFA, San Francisco's City Hall Park, The Dance Palace in Pt. Reyes Station, and more!  In addition, we've expanded our perspective to promote literacy, history, geography, and ecology and have recently performed at community events, libraries, retirement homes and schools, including performances at The Redwoods Retirement Community in Mill Valley, CA and Glenview Elementary School in Oakland, CA.

One of our popular sketches follows a young Vermont farmer who moves to the Big City after being “tricked off his land”. Nearing despair, he discovers that he has one skill and one skill only that is valued in The City… performing the world’s greatest chicken impression! 

“An Awkward Romance”, “The Bottle Dance”, and “The Secret Asian Man”, along with Ted’s, Mike’s and Lawrence’s embarrassingly intimate friendship, are featured with plenty of music, sing-a-longs, short monologues and dialogues, dances, mimes, fictitious advertisements, and irreverent comedy skits, many of which also present positive lessons in diversity, friendship, learning, and respect for the environment.


What does this all mean to us?

Mike: “I was born and raised in Middlebury, Vermont.  For ten years I've been telling my best friends and comedy conspirators, Lawrence and Ted, all about my home state.  It’s been a big part of our shared labor of love, our comedy troupe, Uncle Buzzy.  After ten years, I’m finally bringing them home with me!  I can’t wait to see their faces!  I can’t wait to see my hometown through their eyes!  (And I hope I haven’t been exaggerating too too much!) Ha!”

Lawrence: “Mike has been talking about Vermont and putting the Green Mountain flavor in our shows for 10 years now. Vermont has been such a big part of Uncle Buzzy. For me, going to Vermont will be like going to school with a foreign exchange student, and then finally going to visit his home country!  It is an honor & a privilege to finally play in Vermont, and to bring to life all of our humor, music, and down-home perspectives in front of the actual people who inspired it all!  I truly can’t wait for this to happen!”

Ted: “This tour is a ‘rock-star-dream-come-true’ experience for me.  Traveling throughout the state, getting drunk with my troupe-mates, groupies in every town, trashing hotel rooms, and rockin' and rollin', man!  [Mike & Lawrence:  “Ted! Ted! Ted! We're going to VERMONT. And we are NOT Mötley Crüe!”]  Oh well...still beats doing math.  This has been a childhood fantasy of mine ever since I picked up the guitar at 16.  This is gonna rock!  Yay!”


Your Impact

Uncle Buzzy was formed over 10 years ago and has performed throughout the San Francisco Bay Area.  But we have NEVER performed in Vermont, where Buzzy's roots were first laid to ground.   In a way, you can say that Vermont has been underserved with Buzzy's brand of entertainment for all these years.  It is high time that we perform for the good folks of the Green Mountain State, and bring our down-home humor and music back to the place that inspired it all!  

We need at least $3,667.00 in order to play several shows throughout Vermont & California.

The money will be used as follows:

  • Show production expenses, such as bookings, stage props, marketing and other show-related expenses.
  • Travel expenses for three cast members, including round-trip airfare from SFO to BTV, rental car, and low-rent accommodations throughout the tour. 
Your support can make this happen as Uncle Buzzy celebrates its 10th year anniversary! 
========================================================


==========================================================

Please give generously to Uncle Buzzy's Hometown Theater Show...because a "mime" is a terrible thing to waste!

==========================================================

***************************************************

Thank you very much for your support!

***************************************************


CLICK HERE FOR LATEST TOUR DATES & INFO!

learning, and respect for the environment.






What does this all mean to us?

Mike: “I was born
and raised in Middlebury, Vermont.  For ten years I've been telling my best friends and
comedy conspirators, Lawrence and Ted, all about my home state.  It’s been
a big part of our shared labor of love, our comedy troupe, Uncle Buzzy.
 After ten years, I’m finally bringing them home with me!  I can’t
wait to see their faces!  I can’t wait to see my hometown through their
eyes!  (And I hope I haven’t been exaggerating too too much!) Ha!”
Lawrence: “Mike has been talking about
Vermont and putting the Green Mountain
flavor in our shows for 10 years now. Vermont has been such a big part of Uncle
Buzzy. For me, going to Vermont
will be like going to school with a foreign exchange student, and then finally
going to visit his home country!  It is an honor & a privilege to
finally play in Vermont,
and to bring to life all of our humor, music, and down-home perspectives in
front of the actual people who inspired it all!  I truly can’t wait for
this to happen!”

Ted: “This
tour is a ‘rock-star-dream-come-true’ experience for me.  Traveling
throughout the state, getting drunk with my troupe-mates, groupies in every
town, trashing hotel rooms, and rockin' and rollin', man!  [Mike
& Lawrence:  “Ted! Ted! Ted! We're going to VERMONT. And we are NOT Mötley Crüe!”]  Oh well...still beats doing math.
 This has been a childhood fantasy of mine ever since I picked up the
guitar at 16.  This is gonna rock!  Yay!”



Your Impact
 Uncle Buzzy was formed over 10 years ago and has performed throughout the San Francisco Bay Area.  But we have NEVER performed in Vermont, where Buzzy's roots were first laid to ground.   In a way, you can say that Vermont has been underserved with Buzzy's brand of entertainment for all these years.  It is high time that we perform for the good folks of the Green Mountain State, and bring our down-home humor and music back to the place that inspired it all!  

We need at least $3,667.00 in order to play several shows throughout Vermont & California.
The money will be used as follows:

Show production expenses, such as bookings, stage props, marketing and other show-related expenses.
Travel expenses for three cast members, including round-trip airfare from SFO to BTV, rental car, and low-rent accommodations throughout the tour. 

Your support can make this happen as Uncle Buzzy celebrates its 10th year anniversary! 
========================================================



==========================================================
Please give generously to Uncle Buzzy's Hometown Theater Show...because a "mime" is a terrible thing to waste!
==========================================================



***************************************************
Thank you very much for your support!
***************************************************





CLICK HERE FOR LATEST TOUR DATES & INFO!

story:
What is BABY HUBRIS?

The WORLD PREMIERE of a play, of course! :D
  • Leslie, an overworked single mom starts hallucinating the ghost of Dr. Benjamin Spock until he becomes her personal guru. With sex, poetry, and magical realism Leslie gives birth to her power. Wyatt writes musicals about Greek gods, and six month old baby Jack - talks. 
  • www.BabyHubris.com
  • Baby Hubris on Facebook
  • Baby Hubris listing on FringeNYC.Org

Who am I? 

  • Jacqui Rêgo is an actor/writer based out of Brooklyn, NY.
  • Six years in the making, countless other projects came and went, but BABY HUBRIS was somehow always living in my mind, taking space in my soul, and beating out it's poetry (quite literally) in my heart. It was a voice that decided of it's own accord it must rise up howl. BABY HUBRIS' acceptance to International Fringe Festival is a DREAM COME TRUE and the time has come to breathe life and give birth to this baby! 

What is the International Fringe Festival - NYC?

  • The largest multi-arts festival in North America.
  • FringeNYC has attendance of 75,000 people! Wowza!
  • The stomping grounds for TONY award winning shows and some of the most exciting emerging theater in the country.
  • *FUN fact* Each application to the Fringe is adjudicated seven hours before deciding on admittance to the festival. 

Putting on a play in NYC

Where the money goes:

  •  Building sets 
  • Obtaining mandatory FDNY fire safety certificates for set pieces, insurance & gratuity for your fire guard. 
  • Fringe submission ($40) & registration ($700), 
  • Paying stipends to actors, directors, and stage crew.
  • Lighting and sound design creation and board operators for performnces.
  •  Booking rehearsal space
  • Paying graphic designers/marketing/photographers/ACR (mandatory Fringe liaison)
  • Printing programs, and building a website.

How you (yes, you! :D) can help!

  • Donate, receive one of our one-of-a-kind perks and be part of the adventure!
  • Forward this IndieGoGo campaign to one and all!
  • Come and see the show! Listings available under "Baby Hubris" on www.fringenyc.org .

story:
Elements Theatre Collective

Our mission is to engage the local community by creating professional quality theatre that is accessible to all audiences.  We believe that making theatre accessible will inspire people who haven't experienced theatre and spark a conversation about topics that are pertinent to our community.

This year marks our fourth season, and we have decided to tackle the theme of Power and Influence.  We kicked off the season with Nixon's Nixon by Russell Lees. An astounding, personal evening with President Nixon and Secretary of State Henry Kissinger the night before Nixon resigns.  Nixon's Nixon was widely acclaimed, and brought Elements our second Indy award for our amazing ensemble!

We are closing the season with A Bright New Boise by Samuel D. Hunter.  In this powerful play, a man who gave up his son at birth, reconnects with him 20 years later.  The father decides to take a job at the same Hobby Lobby where his son works, in an effort to get to know him before disclosing that he is the biological father. 

A Bright New Boise is a thought provoking work that explores internal and external struggles with religion and family. We have our cast, and our crew, and we want to take this show on the road!  We will travel throughout Santa Barbara County, with performances in Carpenteria, Santa Barbara, Goleta and Lompoc.  All spaces are donated and, as always, tickets are FREE! 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $3,500 to bring A Bright New Boise to life.  Elements always keeps our shows free to audiences by partnering with venues who donate their spaces for our use, and by working with amazing volunteers through out the run of the show. In addition, local friends and businesses have donated materials for our sets, costumes and other production needs. 

With the generous support of our community, and our dedication to keeping costs low, we are able to keep our ticket prices FREE, and reach more audiences. However, we need your help. Please consider becoming part of our community and our collective by supporting our campaign today with a tax- deductible donation.

We want to make this production our best one yet! And you can help!

Here's where the funds we raise will go:

~ $900 will cover the small stipends to pay our actors, our director and our stage manager

~$700 With this money, we'll purchase the rights to the script, which will allow us to take this show to 13 different places in the Santa Barbara area.

~$700 will cover the costs of transporting the show to our diverse venues across Santa Barbara County.  The truck for carrying supplies has been generously discounted for our use! 

~$500 A lot of our supplies for the set will be donated, but we'll still need to purchase some items. (We have to build an old, functioning TV, and lockers! )

~$300 This is our first year providing our own insurance!  This will help cover the cost of insurance for this production. 

~$200  This will go to costumes and props.  We'll need some of those fancy work smocks!  

~$200 will help us promote the show and reach out to new audiences through advertising outlets and cover the cost of printed materials.

The Impact

Your contribution will help make our final production of this season the best one so far!  We are continuously growing and you have helped our small company through all the growing pains!  With our previous campaign we asked your help to purchase lighting equipment.  You responded with enthusiasm and now we are able to keep costs down by using our own amazing LED lights that travel with us show to show. This show has one of our largest casts yet, and the most involved set (even with our minimalist mindset!!!).  We love supporting the range of diverse talent in the area. We also believe that providing performance opportunities to artists will help cultivate the artistic community even further.

We believe in bringing our shows to people who wouldn't have access to theater otherwise, which is why we love to perform at Casa Esperanza Homeless Center, the Carpinteria Women's Club, and Friendship Manor amongst our many other venues.  This time, we've received requests to bring our shows to even more locations.  Including a new location in Isla Vista, and our furthest reach yet, in Lompoc.  We want to bring this powerful piece of theatre to as many places as possible! Your donation could make the difference for an entire community.

Risks & Challenges

With every show we do, we always have to overcome some unforeseen obstacle, no matter how we plan!  Actors get sick, venues close, and cars break down.  By funding our campaign you'll allow us to keep our reserve funds available for all those pesky road blocks, and for our future seasons.
As we become a stronger company with our growth, we have accumulated more 'stuff'.  One of the largest obstacles in our way has been with transportation.  Currently we're borrowing, renting, and bribing van and truck owners to help out when they can.  Keeping this cost down is challenging!  We hope that by subsidizing A Bright New Boise with this fundraiser, we'll be able to keep saving for a vehicle of our own.

Other Ways You Can Help

We get that sometimes donating money isn't an option.  But there is a plethora of volunteer opportunities! 

Want to help with set-up/tear down of a show, help manage the house, post flyers, help us with upcoming events, or just plain get involved?

 Email-us:  contact@elementstc.org

or check out our website! 

http://www.elementstc.org/

And of course, come see the show!!

story:
On December 19, 2014 we received the most exciting news a team of endurance athletes could receive! “We would like to inform you that after review, our technical board has accepted and approved your participation in the 2016, Return of the Patagonia Expedition race.”

At last we could take our mission to increase awareness of prostate cancer to a global audience. This year alone over 230,000 men in the U.S. will be effected by prostate cancer, Thirty Thousand will die. The Team manager, mentor, and coach is currently a prostate cancer patient!

Known as the "Race to the End of the World", the 10-day event challenges co-ed international teams of four athletes in the disciplines of trekking, sea kayaking, orienteering, and mountain biking. The race takes place on a different course each year, with competitors using a map and compass to navigate through previously unknown terrain. Due to its challenging nature, it is also known as "The Last Wild Race" and has been described as "The World’s toughest adventure race."

This Kickstarter Project is to create a full length documentary of four American athletes on their mission to race for a purpose, The End of Prostate Cancer and to be the first all American Team to win the great Patagonia Expedition race and we would like you to JOIN OUR CAUSE! The documentary team will be with the racers from the first team training at the Grand Canyon in May, all the way through the end of the race in Patagonia.www.patagonianexpeditionrace.com

Why are we creating a documentary and why does our USA team want to take on such a daunting challenge by competing in "The Worlds Hardest Race?" Why are they willing to risk their health in unfathomable conditions and situations?  Our team members are not only athletes, they're everyday Americans, a mother, a student, a teacher and all have been effected by Prostate Cancer. They have been forged through competitiveness, lifestyle and an all out need to rise above any challenge. 

They bring to the table the knowledge that prostate cancer is a disease that effects 1 in 6 men globally. This year alone over 230,000 men in the U.S. will be effected by prostate cancer,Thirty Thousand will die. Their mentor and coach is currently a prostate cancer patient.

This documentary is being made for many reasons. We will be highlighting our team, their mission, and their goal to raise awareness through their selected charity, Zero the end of Prostate Cancer. This documentary will not only entertain and educate people around the world about ultra athletes and the Patagonia Expedition Race, but it will allow them to be part of something bigger than themselves.  You (our backers) will be donating into a chance to experience first hand, what a year of commitment to train and win a race like this is like, while living the race and supporting their mission with them!

As you watch the videos and read the incredible achievements of each individual below, you will immediately recognize their specialty skill sets and their dedication to their sports. More importantly you will see the character and the determination each one brings to the team. 

What do the USA Adventure Addicts bring to the Patagonia Expedition Race? Not just a group of great athletes with great skill sets, but a group of men and women dedicated to the three “C’s”, Character, Commitment and Cohesiveness. During their trek across Patagonia, these 4 people will meet challenges they have never faced, moments of despair and situations that will require them to dig deeper than they ever have before. They will need to rely on the team, and you, to get them through.

We would love for you to join our team and experience this journey of a lifetime with us. Your support of the USA Adventure Addicts will give them the opportunity to share with the world their commitment to the United States and Zero the End of Prostate Cancer, with honor, dignity and success.

www.usaadventureaddicts.com

story:
JYM Theatre Co. is a Melbourne-based company and prides itself on producing exceptional musical theatre and has built a reputation on nurturing and developing talent and highly valuing our cast, crew and supporters.

JYM provides the opportunity for people to get involved in all aspects of musical theatre production and encourages diversity in it's membership. It's all about creativity, teamwork, friendship and fun.

Staging sell-out hits such as Avenue Q, The 25th Annual Putnam County Spelling Bee and The Producers, the JYM team are excited to be staging Sondheim's Tony award winning musical Merrily We Roll Along. 

Producing theatre is a costly endeavour and unfortunately small companies like ourselves are unable to operate on box-office sales alone. As a not-for-profit company, we rely on the generosity of supporters to help to raise the bar and take our production to the next level. 

A message from the Team

We're so glad that you're thinking about supporting our show and we really hope you come on board. 

Theatre is a wonderful, magical place where anything can happen...if you have the right people in your corner. It's not just about the people who get up on stage, but all of the people who help make a show happen, from the person who buys a program, to the person who operates the spotlight. 

 As a small boutique theatre company, we have an amazing group of people collaborating on this show (and most of them are volunteering outside of their regular work/home/life duties), but we also have the challenge of limited resources.We want to raise the bar and take our production to the next level, and we want you to join us on the journey. 

If we reach our fundraising target, it will open the door to fabulous materials, resources and opportunities that we would love to access to ensure Merrily is the best it can possibly be. Anything you can contribute will help make our show that little bit more magical so please, dig deep, join the JYM family, and know that you've helped create the magic!

Tickets for the show can be purchased through the JYM Theatre website:  www.jymtheatre.com


Don't believe us? Listen to Beth and Charley ...


Cast

Frank: Patrick Hill
Charley:  Jonathan Goldberg
Mary:  Stephanie John 
Gussie: Liana Brener
Beth: Jen Bush
Joe:  Nick Backstrom
Meg:  Rachel Tigel
KT:  Talia Zyngier
Frank Jr:  Sören Adkin

Ensemble:

Mr Spencer/Terry: Joshua Balbin
Mrs Spencer/Dory: Rachel Faigen
Ru: Romi Freedman
Jerome: Dave McCarthie
Tyler: Callum McDonald
Scotty: Emma Nicolazzo
Bunker/Make Up Artist: Romy Snow
Photographer: Danny Starr



Meet the Team

We are ecstatic to announce that actor/director Pip Mushin (Josh Jarman 2004, King Kong  2005, Strictly Ballroom  1992 ) is directing our production. Pip has a wealth of experience from over 25 years in theatre, film and television. Click here to read more about Pip's career.

"I am thrilled to be directing Sondheim's Merrily We Roll Along. It's clever, funny, moving and has a fabulous score. It's actually very commercial, and everyone involved is just so excited at the opportunity to create a dynamic, fresh and unique production."

                                                     

Phil Setton is our Musical Director and this is his fifth show MD'ing for JYM. When not at rehearsals, Phil is an acoustics engineer, attempting to make the world a quieter place. He really is all about the music.

                                                     

Brendy Ford is our ever fabulous choreographer. He joined JYM on stage in The Producers, earning him a Guild award nomination for Best Cameo. An experienced producer and choreographer, he has worked on various musical productions, as well as ARIA nominated electronic music duo Peking Duck's video Feel's Like. A regular both on and off stage he's appear in the Melbourne MIDSUMMA festival and is working on his next production with FORD&SLY. 

                                                             

Shari Cohen is the woman behind the behind the scenes. The captain of the ship and everyone's go-to for anything show related, Shari is thrilled to be taking on the challenge that is Merrily.                                         

                                           


About the show

Merrily We Roll Along begins in the present and moves backwards, tracing the lives of wealthy, jaded composer Franklin Shepard and his two estranged friends in this thrilling and compelling Broadway fable about friendship, compromise and the high price of success. Stephen Sondheim and George Furth expertly blend the excitement and energy of a backstage musical with a poignant and emotional contemporary story about the importance of staying true to one's ideals. Merrily We Roll Along crackles with the wit, humour and intensity that embody the spirit of New York City and is a spirited and moving cautionary tale for anyone who has ever pursued a dream. 

Meet the cast

                                                                                Our Frank                                                                                                                            

Patrick has been performing in Australia and internationally for over twenty years. His career has included appearing as Munkustrap in the 2014 South Korea national tour of Andrew Lloyd Webber's hit musical CATS. Also in 2014, Patrick appeared as a Seabee and played Commander Harbison as a cover in the Australian tour of Rodgers & Hammerstein's South Pacific with Opera Australia and is thrilled to be making his JYM debut in Merrily. 

                                                                       Our Charley

                                                

A dentist by day and a father to twin boys, Jonathan has always had a love for live theatre. Past productions include Rags, Bye Bye Birdie, The Last Five Years, Lost in Yonkers, Conversations with my Father and Falsettos, the last of which he won a Victorian Music Theatre Guild Award for. Jonathan joined JYM in 2006 as Seymour in Little Shop of Horrors and again in 2012 as Nicky Avenue Q.

                                                                    Our Mary

                                             

 
Stephanie is thrilled to play Mary Flynn in Merrily We Roll Along. A recent graduate from the APO Arts Academy, she has performed for companies such as the Victorian Opera and as a soloist for the MTO. She received a Victorian Guild Award nomination for Best Actress in a Supporting Role for her portrayal as Liliane La Fluer in Nine and, more recently has performed as a singer for Crown Casino Entertainment and been a back-up vocalist for The Voice star, Thando Sikwila. Her band ATA 440 recently released its first album, WAX MUSEUM.
                                                         
                                                            Here's To Us!
                                                           Who's Like Us?
                                                               Damn Few! 

                                                    


Buy your tickets for the show today at the JYM Theatre website:  www.jymtheatre.com
story_txt:
JYM Theatre Co. is a Melbourne-based company and prides itself on producing exceptional musical theatre and has built a reputation on nurturing and developing talent and highly valuing our cast, crew and supporters.
JYM provides the opportunity for people to get involved in all aspects of musical theatre production and encourages diversity in it's membership. It's all about creativity, teamwork, friendship and fun.
Staging sell-out hits such as Avenue Q, The 25th Annual Putnam County Spelling Bee and The Producers, the JYM team are excited to be staging Sondheim's Tony award winning musical Merrily We Roll Along. 
Producing theatre is a costly endeavour and unfortunately small companies like ourselves are unable to operate on box-office sales alone. As a not-for-profit company, we rely on the generosity of supporters to help to raise the bar and take our production to the next level. 
A message from the Team
We're so glad that you're thinking about supporting our show and we really hope you come on board. 
Theatre is a wonderful, magical place where anything can happen...if you have the right people in your corner. It's not just about the people who get up on stage, but all of the people who help make a show happen, from the person who buys a program, to the person who operates the spotlight. 
 As a small boutique theatre company, we have an amazing group of people collaborating on this show (and most of them are volunteering outside of their regular work/home/life duties), but we also have the challenge of limited resources.We want to raise the bar and take our production to the next level, and we want you to join us on the journey. 
If we reach our fundraising target, it will open the door to fabulous materials, resources and opportunities that we would love to access to ensure Merrily is the best it can possibly be. Anything you can contribute will help make our show that little bit more magical so please, dig deep, join the JYM family, and know that you've helped create the magic!
Tickets for the show can be purchased through the JYM Theatre website:  www.jymtheatre.com

Don't believe us? Listen to Beth and Charley ...

Cast



Frank: Patrick HillCharley:  Jonathan GoldbergMary:  Stephanie John Gussie: Liana BrenerBeth: Jen BushJoe:  Nick BackstromMeg:  Rachel TigelKT:  Talia ZyngierFrank Jr:  Sören Adkin
Ensemble:
Mr Spencer/Terry: Joshua BalbinMrs Spencer/Dory: Rachel FaigenRu: Romi FreedmanJerome: Dave McCarthieTyler: Callum McDonaldScotty: Emma NicolazzoBunker/Make Up Artist: Romy SnowPhotographer: Danny Starr





Meet the Team
We are ecstatic to announce that actor/director Pip Mushin (Josh Jarman 2004, King Kong  2005, Strictly Ballroom  1992 ) is directing our production. Pip has a wealth of experience from over 25 years in theatre, film and television. Click here to read more about Pip's career.
"I am thrilled to be directing Sondheim's Merrily We Roll Along. It's clever, funny, moving and has a fabulous score. It's actually very commercial, and everyone involved is just so excited at the opportunity to create a dynamic, fresh and unique production."
                                                     
Phil Setton is our Musical Director and this is his fifth show MD'ing for JYM. When not at rehearsals, Phil is an acoustics engineer, attempting to make the world a quieter place. He really is all about the music.
                                                     
Brendy Ford is our ever fabulous choreographer. He joined JYM on stage in The Producers, earning him a Guild award nomination for Best Cameo. An experienced producer and choreographer, he has worked on various musical productions, as well as ARIA nominated electronic music duo Peking Duck's video Feel's Like. A regular both on and off stage he's appear in the Melbourne MIDSUMMA festival and is working on his next production with FORD&SLY. 
                                                             
Shari Cohen is the woman behind the behind the scenes. The captain of the ship and everyone's go-to for anything show related, Shari is thrilled to be taking on the challenge that is Merrily.                                         

                                           

About the show

Merrily We Roll Along begins in the present and moves backwards, tracing the lives of wealthy, jaded composer Franklin Shepard and his two estranged friends in this thrilling and compelling Broadway fable about friendship, compromise and the high price of success. Stephen Sondheim and George Furth expertly blend the excitement and energy of a backstage musical with a poignant and emotional contemporary story about the importance of staying true to one's ideals. Merrily We Roll Along crackles with the wit, humour and intensity that embody the spirit of New York City and is a spirited and moving cautionary tale for anyone who has ever pursued a dream. 
Meet the cast
                                                                                Our Frank                                                                                                                            
Patrick has been performing in Australia and internationally for over twenty years. His career has included appearing as Munkustrap in the 2014 South Korea national tour of Andrew Lloyd Webber's hit musical CATS. Also in 2014, Patrick appeared as a Seabee and played Commander Harbison as a cover in the Australian tour of Rodgers & Hammerstein's South Pacific with Opera Australia and is thrilled to be making his JYM debut in Merrily. 
                                                                       Our Charley
                                                
A dentist by day and a father to twin boys, Jonathan has always had a love for live theatre. Past productions include Rags, Bye Bye Birdie, The Last Five Years, Lost in Yonkers, Conversations with my Father and Falsettos, the last of which he won a Victorian Music Theatre Guild Award for. Jonathan joined JYM in 2006 as Seymour in Little Shop of Horrors and again in 2012 as Nicky Avenue Q.                                                                    Our Mary                                              Stephanie is thrilled to play Mary Flynn in Merrily We Roll Along. A recent graduate from the APO Arts Academy, she has performed for companies such as the Victorian Opera and as a soloist for the MTO. She received a Victorian Guild Award nomination for Best Actress in a Supporting Role for her portrayal as Liliane La Fluer in Nine and, more recently has performed as a singer for Crown Casino Entertainment and been a back-up vocalist for The Voice star, Thando Sikwila. Her band ATA 440 recently released its first album, WAX MUSEUM.                                                         

                                                            Here's To Us!                                                           Who's Like Us?                                                               Damn Few!                                                     




Buy your tickets for the show today at the JYM Theatre website:  www.jymtheatre.com

story:
The Beautiful Game is a celebration of all things football, capturing the true essence of our nation’s love affair with the only game that matters. The Beautiful Game is an ode to all of the make-believe Maradona’s, Sunday Leaguers and die hard fans, reminding us all that Football truly is, the people’s game. Using a backdrop of famous commentary, catchy songs and personal stories, the work endeavours to take contemporary dance to football fans. Next Door Dance aim to delve into the heart of football, taking the audience on a witty journey of nostalgia and joy.

Next Door Dance is a local dance company, for local people. Formed in May 2014, Next Door Dance is made up of six dance artists who work extensively across the East Midlands; teaching, making, performing and project managing. 

We would like to begin a research and development period, where we work across the East Midlands connecting with football fans and clubs. We will deliver physical workshops and creative consultations in order to gather stories that will inform the choreography and build the sound for the performances. Building relationships with clubs, teams and schools will also allow us to develop our audiences for future performances.

Next Door Dance aim to get folk that love football, excited about dance. We hope to bridge the gap a little bit between sport and dance.

We are currently writing an Arts Council bid to fund the project. Your contribution will help strengthen our bid and act as match funding. 

Thank you for taking the time to read our pledge and a HUGE thank you for your support! Please share this post and spread the word.

story:
Spade Theatre is a new, English Theatre group in Montreal, Quebec. They produce contemporary plays while using early 20th century training techniques-geared towards behavioural psychology and emotional memory- to present vulnerable and very intimate performances to their audiences. Their first show in the city of Montreal will be John Murrell’s Waiting for the Parade: a play set in Calgary, Alberta that magnifies the lives of 5 civilian women during WWII.

Murrell gives us beautiful insight on the perspective of women during this time of war. When commissioned by ATP to write a Canadian history play, he interviewed people who had lived through the war, and found that the stories he liked best were those of the women. He stated that “Women are the connective tissue which allows the human race to keep faith that normal life will ultimately return. Women remind us, with and resilience, of the great importance of family, and also that family is not everything; of the great importance of patriotism, and also that patriotism is not everything. Their pragmatism is utterly heroic.” It is this same bravery, strength, and independence that we want to encourage when presenting Waiting for the Parade. These women paved a beautiful and powerful path towards women’s’ rights on which we need to continue to march.

This project will be performed in a very intimate setting that will allow the audience to feel as though they are with these women in their homes, and at their jobs. They will be connected physically and emotionally to these characters and actresses throughout the play; even during intermission! Spade Theatre’s production of Waiting for the Parade will be a different experience for most with its incredibly personal and embracing environment; an experience that we want to share with you all in any way possible! Visit us at www.spadetheatre.com where you can follow us on Instagram, Facebook, and twitter.

Producing a show when you are starting out requires a minimum budget for rental of venue, rights, costumes, promotional material, and much more. When you support this production, you are helping a start-up company that is going to be influential in the theatre community. We hope that you enjoy watching this short fundraising video that will give you a bit more insight about the play and about who we are as a troupe. This project would not be possible without the support and encouragement of our friends, peers, and family, and so we thank you.

story:
Porter

As part of the SPF (Summer Performance Festival) run by Joe Landini, Porter premieres at ODC Theater July 10 and 12, 2015 at 9pm through the Summer Performance Festival run by SafeHouse Arts.

Directed by Bianca Cabrera with an original score composed by Ben Juodvalkis and performed by Mallory Markham, Rebecca Morris, Odessa Avianna Perez, Emma Salmon, Nell Suttles and Ali Weeks.

Tickets at odcdance.org

Porter uses the singular history of West Oakland rail workers as inspiration to create a dance considering the widespread poetics of history, belonging, change and invention. Porter is an abstract story about the feast/famine nature of evolving and devolving neighborhoods. Using physical themes of locomotion, coming, going, union, and isolation, Porter examines the aftermath of abundance, embodies the persistent green life that bursts upward out of rubble, and imitates cycles of prosperity and cycles of exclusivity. Particularly inspired by the now uninhabitable 16th Street Train Station in West Oakland, Blind Tiger imagines the stories inside those walls as physical fables. This lonely relic in West Oakland was completed in 1912 to accommodate the city’s surging population in the wake of the 1906 earthquake in San Francisco. 

What we need, why we need it 

We need to raise $4900 to pay for our artist's blood, sweat and tears. This all star cast rehearses 12 hours a week during this 6 month process. Everything raised here on Indiegogo is directly routed to the pockets of these heroes. 

Here's why the Porter Artists think you should get involved as a societal donor:

Bianca Cabrera - I have invited an incredible cast of collaborators to help me bring Porter to greater heights than any other BTS production to date. I know this is a powerful team and it is because of their unfaltering commitment that I can create this amazing new work. Each artist brings a distinct and specific gift to this project; each one deserves compensation that matches their commitment. 

Ben Juodvalkis - Ben Juodvalkis' goal for this project is 'more heart.' What does that mean? Find out! benjuodvalkis.com

Mallory Markham - In the 4 years I have been dancing with Bianca Cabrera and Blind Tiger Society, I have been constantly pushed to reach new heights in my creative and athletic self. BTS allows me to find my artistic voice in an atmosphere void of judgement. We are hungry for adventure and curious in nature. Explorative, ferocious, raw, and vulnerable, the movement transcends the 4th wall creating an experience both performer and audience member can share.

Rebecca Morris - In Blind Tiger, Rebecca becomes beyond human, with wings extending from her fingertips and tap roots reaching from her toes, doing work that peels back the layers of well-formed technique to find the bold and true underneath. This is her second season with Blind Tiger Society. 

Odessa Avianna Perez - Blind Tiger satisfies Odessa's curiosity in where the fantastical meets the physical, where the fierce growl meets the tender purr, and challenges her assemblage of where sequence meets presence. This is her second go-round this rodeo.

Emma Salmon - Blind Tiger  Society provides a space that wholly supports embodied honesty, palpable physicality, unapologetic authenticity and the celebration of all bodies. 

Nell Suttles - Blind Tiger is where Nell pursues her passion for intriguing, powerful and stunningly evocative movement while pushing her strength and finesse beyond it's limits.

Ali Weeks -  Blind Tiger Society feeds her desire for the intensely theatrical, aggressively athletic, and unabashedly bold while progressing her technique and opening her mind. This is her second season with BTS.

How your tax deductible donation makes an impact

Here are some the ways your tax deductible donation will  impact this process:

  • You are making it possible for Blind Tiger create a professional work environment where the bar is set high.
  • Dancers are able to arrive at rehearsal unencumbered by the financial burden that often accompanies participation in a dance project. 
  • We are able to round out a beautiful composition of dance with an amazing sound score and handmade costumes.
  • We are free to concentrate efforts into promotion and marketing of the performances. 
  • Your donation makes a statement about the importance of arts and culture in your community thereby creating a visible, viable and valuable paradigm shift.

What else we have going on

Producing a dance show is very expensive! Artist fees are only a percentage of what the actual cost is for performances. Most of the other fees will be paid out of pocket by the Artistic Director. Your donation vastly increases Blind Tiger's ability to resource energy for these other major costs.

  • Theater rental costs
  • Marketing and promotional costs
  • Rehearsal space costs
  • Materials for costumes

You can still help even if you can't donate!

Come to the show! Like us on Facebook! Follow us on Twitter! Follow us on Tumblr! Tell your friends about us! 

Thank you so much for checking out our campaign!

story:
Once upon a time, long, long, ago... specifically, this past January, a theatre company was born.

Ten second year BFAs at The New School for Drama decided to spend their winter break doing what they loved most - a play. It quickly grew from it's origin as a studio project, and premiered off-off Broadway on January 30, 2015.

The first run was wildly successful, not to mention an absolute joy to work on - which is why we're thrilled to have been accepted to The New York International Fringe Festival! However, to put up a production of the quality that this play deserves, we need your help.

Your contribution will help us pay festival fees, insurance, our wonderful designers, and many more elements that are crucial in putting together the show. In additional to our undying love and gratitude, there are a number of COOL PERKS to thank you for your donation! Check them out in the sidebar!

Can't donate? Still want to help? No sweat. Just share this page with your favorite 5 (or 500) people - the more who hear about us, the merrier!

Thank you so much for your support, and for helping tell a story that not only features a central gay character without sexuality as a conflict, but also supports the destigmatization of depression and suicide - and anything else that may threaten a person's journey towards self worth - it means the absolute world to us. 

If you, or anyone you may know, is suffering - please reach out.
And if you can - please take a look at these deserving causes as well: 

NYC Guide to Suicide Prevention, Services, and Resources
The Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual & Transgender Community Center

Stay Dirty.

xoxo,

Dirty Dishes Theatre Company

"O' Save Us, St. Sophia" -

Written by Mikey Craighead;
Co-Artistic Director, Dirty Dishes

Directed by Sophia Lana Cohen Smith;
Co-Artistic Director, Dirty Dishes

story:
Short Summary

Skull of Yorick Productions and Fix in art as a form of resistence and resilience  this summer are persisting with their plans to found the first Opera Festival in Thessaloniki, Greece.

http://www.skullofyorickproductions.com/

https://www.facebook.com/fixinart?fref=ts

Our ambitious plan for the opera festival is to put on 5 operas! 

The first four operas will be FREE OF CHARGE  and will be performed in two of the most spectacular open air spaces of Thessaloniki – the ancient Roman market and the Courtyard of the King’s Palace. 

Norma will be presented at the Thessaloniki Concert Hall.  There will be a ticket for this production, however a percentage of the ticket will be given to local charity. 

Dates: (Subject to potential changes)

September 13th, 2015

Il tabarro – Courtyard of the King’s Palace (Free Admission)

September 15th, 2015

Suor Angelica – Courtyard of the King’s Palace (Free Admission)

September 17th, 2015

Dido and Aeneas – Ancient Roman Market (Free Admission)

September 19th, 2015

Carmen – Ancient Roman Market (Free Admission)

September 26th /27th

Norma – Thessaloniki Concert Hall

Performers: Jenny Drivala (https://www.facebook.com/jenny.drivala.7)
 Philip Denis Modinos (https://www.facebook.com/pages/Philip-Modinos-ARTISTIC-PAGE/283273891750354)
Kassandra Dimopoulou (http://www.kassandradimopoulou.com) 


Roman market ruins above Aristotle's squrre in the centre of Thessaloniki


King's Palace in the East of Thessaloniki


The Impact

At this time of change and social realignment, artists around the world must develop a spherical view of their profession in order to thrive.  Even though artistic training is broadly available, opportunities for stable work are scarce and artists must take matters into their own hands to build artistic communities within their respective cities and countries.

Thessaloniki Opera Festival is a prototype of the future being able to produce top notch productions while keeping our costs low allowing us to thrive as we go forward. Not only will your contributions to Thessaloniki Opera Festival help us get opera to the greater public of the Thessaloniki, they will also help all of the arts to survive as we provide an operating template for the future. For all of us who love this art form, an investment this projectg will enable everyone else going forward access to this beautiful music. Because Opera should be for everyone!!! 

Our efforts have the following goals:

· To provide the public of Thessaloniki  with the opportunity to attend such spectacles with ease.

· To provide opportunities for local artists to perform and help build their resume.

· To give the opportunity to young artists to be a part of professional productions as an internship.

· To help create a better image for Thessaloniki and Greece in general, through the establishment of the opera festival. 

· To create an opening for cooperation with foreign artists as an expression of European cooperation and solidarity. 

· To assist with charity work as part of the festival’s main agenda. 


What We Need & What You Get

As you can clearly see from the detailed budget plan the wages for the orchestra, the chorus and even the soloists are nominal and everybody is actually going for the project on a semi volunteer basis. 

Even with such a tight budget , because of the financial woes of our land, we are very worried that our potential sponsors may fall through.  Even though there is tremendous interest around our work, there are banking problems and liquidity problems that may make it impossible to process our applications for sponsorship. 

We request your assistance to keep this idea alive and to remind the world that Greece is first and foremost a land with great culture and people filled with the desire to prosper through hard, honest work.  We sincerely hope that we will be able to show the world that Greece is a source of inspiration and we are hoping that with this assistance we may inspire our countrymen to pick up where they left off, before the difficulties began.  We are going to provide more than 70 people with work. 

So where does your money go 
Grand Total : 21 444 euros

All quotes are in euro ,

  • Risks & Challenges

Developing a new opera festival is a huge undertaking. Developing an opera festival in Greece, with FREE ADMISSION, this September, well, some people just think we are crazy! 

The people assembled to form the team of Thessaloniki's Opera Festival have many talents and years of experience producing and creating.  And if that isn’t enough, add discipline, drive and indefatigable energy!  That’s the kind of passion you find when you get involved with #ThessalonikiOperaFestival.  We won’t give up on our commitment to fulfill every aspect of our mission.  We are personally working on this project every single day for the past two years - that's the kind of commitment you are getting. 

 But we also believe passionately that opera should be for everyone! With your help, we can make sure to keep it thriving by moving Thessaloniki Opera Festival closer to reality- and sharing that journey with you through our campaign profile and facebook group!

Other Ways You Can Help

Lastly, there is something else you can do to help our #ThessalonikiOperaFestival campaign---------you can help us get the word out!!!! Send the link to this Indiegogo page to all of your friends, your email lists, and put it up on your facebook page, twitter, etc. You can also use all of the Indiegogo share tools. Let's make some noise and send the #ThessalonikiOperaFestival campaign far and wide!!!!

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
Short Summary 
Skull of Yorick Productions and Fix in art
as a form of resistence and resilience  this summer are
persisting with their plans to found the first Opera Festival in Thessaloniki,
Greece.
http://www.skullofyorickproductions.com/
https://www.facebook.com/fixinart?fref=ts
Our ambitious plan for the opera festival is to put on
5 operas! 
The first four operas will be FREE OF CHARGE  and will be performed in two of the most spectacular open air spaces of Thessaloniki – the ancient Roman market and the Courtyard of the King’s Palace. 

Norma will
be presented at the Thessaloniki Concert Hall. 
There will be a ticket for this production, however a percentage of the
ticket will be given to local charity. 
Dates: (Subject
to potential changes)

September 13th, 2015
Il
tabarro – Courtyard of the King’s Palace (Free Admission)
September 15th, 2015
Suor
Angelica – Courtyard of the King’s Palace (Free Admission)
September 17th, 2015
Dido
and Aeneas – Ancient Roman Market (Free Admission)
September 19th, 2015
Carmen
– Ancient Roman Market (Free Admission)

September 26th /27th
Norma – Thessaloniki Concert Hall
Performers: Jenny Drivala (https://www.facebook.com/jenny.drivala.7)
 Philip Denis Modinos (https://www.facebook.com/pages/Philip-Modinos-ARTISTIC-PAGE/283273891750354)

Kassandra Dimopoulou (http://www.kassandradimopoulou.com) 



Roman market ruins above Aristotle's squrre in the centre of Thessaloniki



King's Palace in the East of Thessaloniki




The Impact

At this time of change and social realignment, artists around the world must develop a spherical view of their profession in order to thrive.  Even though artistic training is broadly available, opportunities for stable work are scarce and artists must take matters into their own hands to build artistic communities within their respective cities and countries.
Thessaloniki Opera Festival is a prototype of the
future being able to produce top notch productions while keeping our costs low
allowing us to thrive as we go forward. Not only will your contributions to Thessaloniki Opera Festival help us get opera to the greater public of the Thessaloniki, they will also help all of the arts to survive as we
provide an operating template for the future. For all of us who love this art
form, an investment this projectg will enable everyone else going forward access to
this beautiful music. Because Opera should be for everyone!!! 

Our efforts have the following goals:
· To provide the public of Thessaloniki  with the opportunity to attend such spectacles with ease.
· To provide opportunities for local artists to perform and help build their resume.
· To give the opportunity to young artists to be a part of professional productions as an internship.
· To help create a better image for Thessaloniki and Greece in general, through the establishment of the opera festival. 
· To create an opening for cooperation with foreign artists as an expression of European cooperation and solidarity. 
· To assist with charity work as part of the festival’s main agenda. 
   What We Need & What You Get 
As you can clearly see from the detailed budget plan the wages for the orchestra, the chorus and even the soloists are nominal and everybody is actually going for the project on a semi volunteer basis. 
Even with such a tight budget , because of the financial woes of our land, we are very worried that our potential sponsors may fall through.  Even though there is tremendous interest around our work, there are banking problems and liquidity problems that may make it impossible to process our applications for sponsorship. 
We request your assistance to keep this idea alive and to remind the world that Greece is first and foremost a land with great culture and people filled with the desire to prosper through hard, honest work.  We sincerely hope that we will be able to show the world that Greece is a source of inspiration and we are hoping that with this assistance we may inspire our countrymen to pick up where they left off, before the difficulties began.  We are going to provide more than 70 people with work. So where does your money go 
Grand Total : 21 444 euros

All quotes are in euro ,

story:
WILLKOMMEN, BIENVENUE, WELCOME! HELP BIG NOISE THEATRE COMPANY CONTINUE MAKING NOISE IN OUR 2016 SEASON!!



Meine Damen und Herren, Mesdames et Messieurs, Ladies and Gentlemen! 

Willkommen, Bienvenue, & Welcome to all our BEAUUUUTIFUL friends, family and supporters. As we, the "Big Noise Theatre Company" prepare to close our first production of the 2016 season, (Congratulations on a FABULOUS run to the Cast & Crew of "Love, Loss & What I Wore"), we give our sincerest thanks to our loyal supporters. We appreciate knowing that we are a part of a community that values our efforts as a small but widely impacting artistic venue within Des Plaines. We are now launching into preparations for the 2nd production of our season. It is for this reason that we ask you to assist our fundraising efforts by donating to this campaign. We want to continue to serve our surrounding communities, but we simply cannot do it alone! 

"'So... What?' What IS this production?" you may be asking? Well, 'Don't Tell Mama' but we have a  production in store... but due to some contract stipulations, we cannot mention the name. BUT, DON'T FRET 'MEIN HERR'!! We have plenty of ways to share the news! 

We could tell you that this production is the 1967 Tony Awards Winner for Best Musical, Best Original Score, Best Featured Actor, Best Featured Actress, Best Direction of a Musical, Best Choreography, Best Scenic Design & Best Costume Design... ONLY TO COME BACK IN 1998 and sweep the Tony Awards for Best Revival, Best Performance by a Leading Actor, Best Performance by a Leading Actress, Best Featured Actor & Best Featured Actress.

We could also tell you this musical was created by the 'Perfectly Marvelous' creative team of Kander & Ebb, the team behind "Chicago" & "Kiss of the Spider Woman".

Trust us! It couldn't please us more to be able to say the name right now. But, since we cannot, we simply ask that YOU: Our Family, Friends, "Friend of Friends", Fellow Thespians, Artists & Artisans alike: HELP US CONTINUE TO MAKE SOME NOISE!!


A QUICK Look at... 


Winnetka Community Theatre, successor-in-spirit to the Winnetka Drama Guild that counted a young Charlton Heston (That's right... Moses himself..) among its casts in the 1940s, mounted its first show in 1973 thanks in large part to the necessary spark, energy, and outstanding leadership of Rolf Blank. Doug Diggs then became the driving force behind the continued success and artistic growth of the company, which underwent a name change to Winnetka Theatre.


When the Winnetka Community House underwent a significant renovation, WT temporarily relocated to the Des Plaines Prairie Lakes Community Center. As a following developed in that area, the relocation became permanent. By the 2005-2006 season, it was decided that a new name was in order... and thus Big Noise Theatre Company was born: an independent community entity managed by a volunteer Board of Governors.  

THE BNT BOARD OF GOVERNORS:


Peter Rasey | President
Daiva Paulis | Vice President
Marian Kaderbek & Amy Stricker | Secretary
Martha Shuford & Gail Soberski | Treasurer
Ashley Kammrath | Marketing
Roy Brown
Darius Colquitt

Julia Macholl
Rebecca Fortier
David Geinosky
Brad Kisner
Noreen Patel
Ken Preuss
Mike Weaver 


The Impact

BNT has been a successful, long-running company because of the good works of our boards, current & emeritus, and all the performers that lend a hand. The Board, in full, often pays for a lot of the company's expenses (out of pocket) & put in hours upon hours of extra work for the overall success of this amazing legacy. Our casts grow together: From first rehearsals to Closing Sunday Communal Set Strikes...

YES. OUR ACTORS HELP US TAKE OUR ENTIRE SETS APART. THAT'S COMMITMENT!!! We serve a community... but we also cultivate one. We want to continue to do so... So, we're making efforts to raise the funds to continue our extensive, "over 50 year" history. 


What We Need & What You Get


WHERE WILL FUNDING GO??All funding will go directly into the 

production budget for OUR NEXT PRODUCTION:

 "Come here the music play, in a club where a raucous ensemble take the stage nightly to tantalize the crowd--and to leave their troubles outside." This sophisticated, sexy, and dramatic piece was written by the popular team of Kander and Ebb, whose hits include “Chicago” and "Kiss of the Spider Woman", is one of the most popular and powerful shows of the 20th century!  This Tony, Grammy, and Oscar winner, where “the girls are beautiful, the audience is beautiful, and even the orchestra is beautiful!” is set to run April 22 - May 8, 2016


PERKS! PERKS! PERKS!

All donations made will be recognized with a Donor's credit in the playbill and on Social Media, based upon the level of your donation! You will also receive special, limited edition gifts for your generous contribution. (Please see the Perks for more information.) 
Other Ways You Can Help

This Campaign is OUR Opportunity to "Make Noise", but as a supporter, it's also an opportunity for YOU to "Make Noise"with us:

Highlighting our Past....

 

Celebrating Our Present....


 & Working Diligently towards a more Engaging, Challenging & Thought-Provoking Future. We do understand that sometimes, people cannot contribute in a financial sense, but in sharing the vision, you are still a very important factor in this campaign. Many of you have attended BNT productions. Your support of this campaign is critical to our continuation. 

So, please, SHARE this campaign with friends and family. POST it in your social media outlets. TALK to people about the production and give feedback to those it may impact. You can also send people to our Facebook portal, driving folks to show their support of our efforts. The more we're promoted, the more assistance we have the opportunity of receiving. 

In a world where chaos seem to be a constant in life & companies are disappearing, we're grateful for a community that values our existence.  Please, help ensure that we will CONTINUE to remain a "Big" part of the Chicagoland Culture. 

COME HERE THE MUSIC PLAY THIS APRIL!!

story:
The Birds#1. Corpses" is a solo dance show using recorded voices and videos. 

Starting from a selection of fake phone calls of the author searching for artist to produce a show, the story goes deeply in the heart of the nature of the feeling of being rejected or not supported. As a consequence a child uses fear instead of love and consent to grow up. Threat becomes the unique strong feeling with which we face reality. Then the Birds come.

Written by - Alex Cantarelli
Coreography - Stefania Bucci and Alex Cantarelli

Additional music - Arvo Pärt
Body, dance, voice - Stefania Bucci
Voice tracks, idea, direction, light design, original music - Alex Cantarelli

A long trailer (14') could be found on Vimeo Official Page: https://vimeo.com/153115370

Approx dur. 40 minutes

The show will be programmed from 16 to 21 august 2016 at Edinburgh Fringe Festival.
The contribution will cover basic expenses (travel, tech needs). A fixed 20% will be used for public communication. 
Help us !! Have a look on the perks too !!

story:
We are a newly formed theatre company based in Newport, South Wales, and we are currently rehearsing for our first play together. We have set up this donations page to allow followers to help us raise money in order to perform our work in local venues. All support, from following us, making small donations to coming to see our performances would mean a lot to us.

The members of We Do Theatre are; Lorne Taylor, Ryan Cork, Jennifer Maw, Claire Brewster, Luci Cook, Ryan Richards, Nick Smith and Kaitlin Wray.

We are looking to raise enough money to cover our first venue costs, costume purchase/hire, and any props we may use for our current play Shoot Get Treasure Repeat. With any support we receive we can really start to get our much loved performances off the ground and also create a platform for future performances. 

Please spread the word to all of your friends and family. Any amount you give will allow us enough to put on this incredible contemporary play. 

Thank you for all of your support!!


Please Note * we will draw a raffle where Two of our donors will receive a free ticket to the performance.
