story:
A new solo by Joss Carter

"Joss Carter is a master, a visionary, and a true fine artist"

- Ken Ludden, The Huffington Post

Once again, I am making a new contemporary dance theatre and live art solo completely single handedly. More than ever I need your financial support to help me through the physical and mental challenges within the research, development, creation and production processes for  'Anatomy of the Heart'. Already in momentum, this 25 minute solo work seems to be the most testing production yet.

I am looking for a minimum of £1900 but I am hoping that through the diversity of the perks below I will be able to exceed this goal, and give back to you ladies and gentlemen as much as I possibly can. 

Many of you looking at this would have been following, or seen my work before in one way or another, so it comes as no surprise that this performance will be extreme and challenging to both you the audience, and I on many levels. If you are not familiar with my work please check out my website www.JossCarter.co.uk or read a short biography within my campaign profile.

I have given some good thought to what I am able to offer. Not just as a dancer but as an artist using many of my different skills and artistic ideas. I hope that something will entice you to support myself, the development, and the legacy of 'Anatomy of the Heart'.

 

About 'Anatomy of the Heart'

 

"Have you ever felt physically love sick, or just mentally sick of love? This cruel solo pursuit dissects the grotesque self conscious, anxious confessions of a romantically melancholic soul. I will be confronting the barriers between dance theatre and live performance art, stripping the human ego to its core to evoke the depressive methods of my madness within my own personal experiences of love and mental health. With a stage drenched in sadness, I will hang in a world of shame and denial with the hope of unearthing once again, the empathetic archeology of human existence and suffering, aiming to bring further awareness of its conceptual issues into the reality of its audiences."

'Anatomy of the Heart' will premiere at The Place, 17 Dukes Road, London, WC15 9PY on 20th February 2018 at 8pm as part of a triple bill of works during 'Resolution' Choreographic Platform.
Tickets are available to book through www.theplace.org.uk

The research and development for 'AotH' has been kindly supported by: Sadler’s Wells Theatre, Tripspace Projects, and K5 Studio. 

WARNING: This piece contains nudity and graphic imagery which some audiences may find offensive and/or traumatic.

Personal Note: If you have been, or know of anyone suffering from mental health issues please remember that friends, family, the NHS, and other support groups are there to discuss any issues you may be suffering from. For more information on how you can help yourself or someone else please visit: www.NHS.uk or www.mind.org.uk

 

Company and Collaborator credits:

Choreographer/Performer: Joss Carter (www.josscarter.co.uk)
Producer: Joss Carter
Photography: Dean Chalkley (www.deanchalkley.com)
Cinematography: Daniel Lowenstein (www.lowensteinphotofilm.com)
Musical producer: Kit Bodenham (www.soundcloud.com/k80_8)
Special FX: Karolina Kluzniak (www.karolinakluzniak.com)
Rehearsal Director/Dramaturge: TBA
Aerial Rigging: TBA
Stage tech crew: TBA

 

Special thanks to:

Robyn Cabaret, Lee Clayden, Sadler's Wells Theatre, Tripspace Projects, K5 Studio, The Place, Dean Chalkley, Dan Lowenstein, Kit Bodenham, Karolina Kluzniak, Kip Johnson

 

What will you be supporting?

Financing myself to create the artistic work - this includes the research development, any research materials, studio maintainance

 Financing myself to produce the artistic work - this includes the sleepless nights of creating such things like this kickstarter campaign, time spent keeping in contact and up to date with with the theatre, and basically making sure I am doing everything in my will to get an audience into the theatre and make this show a success.

Health and safety - this production is going to be the riskiest creation yet. I HAVE to make sure that all my equipment is of the best quality and safely rigged by a qualified expert. 

Financing collaborators - this includes paying other artists involved Special FX, music producer, aerial rigger, my own technical team, film and photographers, and anyone else involved in the development of the production.

Financing set & stage design materials - this includes litres and litres of fake blood, metres and meters of rope, protective flooring, 

Financing the development and production of marketing and promotion - includes the design and cost of printing flyers, posters and also any online advertisements and sponsorships to spark interest and get bums on seats.

Music licensing - for legal use of any other music involved in the production that has not been created specifically for the production.

The continuation and legacy of the project - because this is only the beginning and I hope that this will, like my other works continue to tour across the world for years to come. 

 

Risks and Challenges

There are so many different complexities of being an independent solo artist and producer. With every venture comes both risks and challenges. Being a self employed artist means having to take risks with time, energy and personal expenditures. BUT.... hopefully with experience, pre planning and passion these can be minimised and over come quite easily. 

The performance has a set date so that will happen no matter what! One risk with offering tickets on here is that the performance evening itself is ticketed to the general public. I need to keep up-to date with the theatre to make sure that there are still tickets available to book through me. I would hate for you to book a reward that includes a ticket and for them to already be sold out. 

As a one man band I end up juggling 7 different swords at the same time. I aim to be on top form but at the same time know that I will run myself into the ground. Please be patient with me...as I have to give full attention to the creating the performance first. 

Some pledges will take longer than others. Anything that is not to do specifically to the research, creation and performance in February will be delivered between April and August. Please remember that I have to create all of this by my own fair hands, whilst still working for other companies and on other projects around the world.

If you have any queries please just get in touch via info@josscarter.co.uk :)

story:
Retrouvez la version française ci-dessous

Gouttes de Théâtre, che cos' è?

Gouttes de Théâtre (Gocce di teatro): il primo festival di teatro francese a Roma!

L'obiettivo del Festival Gouttes de Théâtre (Gocce di Teatro) è di far scoprire al pubblico italiano la lingua et la cultura francesi tramite il teatro nella sua diversità. Il teatro classico, l’opera, spettacoli ispirati dalla letteratura e poesia francesi ma anche teatro contemporaneo saranno rappresentati in questo festival.

L'idea è di portare sulla scena italiana truppe francesi che sono attualmente in scena in Francia e dunque, portare un pezzo della cultura francese in Italia. Scegliendo spettacoli che mantengono un legame con l'Italia, il ponte viene creato tra i due paesi; tra due culture che sono spesso descritte come cugine.

Tuttavia, invece di concentrare gli spettacoli in un breve periodo come per i festival classici, ci è sembrato più interessante cospargere la stagione teatrale romana 2018-2019 con le nostre piccole gocce di teatro francese.

Gli spettacoli in lingua francese saranno sottotitolati in italiano.

Per chi?

Per tutti i francofoni e francofili, per tutti gli amanti del teatro e tutti i curiosi!

Dove? Quando?

Il festival si svolgerà presso il Teatro Vascello a Roma durante tutta la stagione teatrale 2018-2019.

Il Teatro Vascello è stato fondato quasi 30 anni fa da Giancarlo Nanni e Manuela Kustermann nel 1989. Il teatro è specializzato in produzioni contemporanee e gestisce un laboratorio “La Fabbrica dell’attore”.

Oggi il teatro è gestito da Manuela Kustermann, direttrice artistica e Marco Ciuti, direttore amministrativo e organizzativo e ha 360 posti.

Maggiori informazioni => http://teatrovascello.it/sezioni/teatro.htm

La nostra prima goccia, La Traviata del Théâtre des Bouffes du Nord, si terrà dal 6 al 7 ottobre.

 

La nostra prima goccia: La Traviata del Théâtre des Bouffes du Nord

Lo spettacolo è un adattamento della famosa opera di Giuseppe Verdi, lui stesso ispirato da La Signora delle Camelie da Dumas figlio, che scrisse dopo la sua tragica relazione con la cortigiana Marie Duplessis. Violetta, cortigiana parigina in vista e Alfredo, un giovane borghese provenzale, si amano follemente. Violetta rinuncia alla sua vita mondana, ma il padre di Alfredo la costringe alla rottura.

La Traviata è quindi una storia francese, adattata per l'opera da un compositore italiano, poi trasformata in un'opera teatrale in Francia, torna in Italia a Roma per il festival Gocce di teatro. Le Théâtre des Bouffes du Nord, una famosa compagnia francese, presenta Traviata - Ti meriti un futuro migliore , prima in tournée della stagione.

Le Théâtre des Bouffes du Nord dice:

"Nella Traviata - Ti meriti un futuro migliore, gli spettatori sono invitati nell'intimità di Violetta a vedere da vicino il fuoco in cui è coinvolta, tra gli ospiti di questa festa musicale e fantasmagorica che mescola teatro e opera, voci parlate e voci cantanti, dove la distinzione tra strumentisti e cantanti è confusa, dove Charles Baudelaire siede accanto a Christophe Tarkos e dove muoiono i fantasmi di questa Parigi in piena espansione, di cui ora viviamo il futuro."   http://www.bouffesdunord.com/fr/la-saison/traviata

 

Il crowdfunding: A cosa serviranno i fondi?

A portare la famosa Compagnia Théatre des Bouffes du Nord a Roma!

  • Troupe: 21 attori, musiscisti e tecnici
  • Organizzazione logistica: Trasporti e alloggi delle Bouffes du Nord
  • Comunicazione e pubblicità: Supporti cartacei e digitali, elementi graffici web, affissione pubblica,  inserimenti stampa

 

E le altre gocce?

A seguire le Théâtre des Bouffes du Nord, la Compagnie Française de Théâtre de Rome e il Vascello accoglieranno altre compagnie e i loro spettacoli durante la stagione 2018-2019:

  • Les Fourberies de Scapin del Théâtre du Kronope https://www.kronope.com/tout-public/les-fourberies-de-scapin/
  • Antigone della Compagnia La Naïve https://lanaive.fr/antigone/
  • Le Misanthrope della Compagnia Acquaviva  https://www.cieacquaviva.fr/misanthrope
  • Le Troisième Etage della Compagnia Francese di Teatro di Roma
  • Tout Pour Etre Heureux di Christian Poissonneau


La Compagnia e le sue attività

Hélène Sandoval, attrice, regista e direttrice della compagnia, ha fondato il Théâtre Français de Rome nel 2003. Ha frequentato il Conservatoire d’Art Dramatique di Grenoble. Nel 1995, arriva in Italia e frequenta la Scuola d’Arte Drammatica Silvio D’Amico. Per 10 anni, recita in compagnie italiane  in teatri di prestigio di Roma: Teatro Eliseo, Teatro dei Satiri, Teatro della Bugia, Teatro Quirino, Teatro Ambra Jovinelli prima di creare la propria compagnia.

Così è nato il Théâtre Français de Rome (Teatro francese di Roma) nel 2003 con la sua Compagnie Française de Théâtre de Rome, una compagnia teatrale professionale, basata a Roma che ha la particolarità di essere composta solo da attori francofoni. Propongono cori e spettacoli in Francese.

Da 15 anni, il Théâtre Français de Rome promuove la cultura e la lingua francesi attraverso gli autori francesi classici o contemporanei di teatro.

Collaboriamo regolarmente con istituzioni locali come l’Istituto Francese-Centro San Luigi, il Convitto Nazionale o il Lycée Chateaubriand, la scuola francese di Roma.

Proponiamo:

  • Spettacoli teatrali in lingua francese in matinées per le scuole
  • Spettacoli  teatrali in lingua francese con sottotitoli in lingua italiana per un pubblico più ampio.
  • Corsi di teatro in francese presso le scuole francesi e italiane, l’Istituto Francese di Roma e la nostra struttura, per tutte le età (bambini, ragazzi, adulti)
  • Cene spettacolo bilingue con sketch e canzoni
  • Laboratori teatrali e centri estivi in francese per i bambini e gli adolescenti

Maggiori informazioni e attualità della Compagnia => www.teatrofrancese.com

Seguiteci!

Sito internet www.teatrofrancese.com

Facebook della Compagnia https://www.facebook.com/theatrefrancaisrome/

Evento del Festival https://www.facebook.com/events/128851184640465/

Twitter https://twitter.com/teatrofrancese

Instagram https://www.instagram.com/teatrofrancese/

Newsletter: Iscriversi a info@teatrofrancese.com

 

VERSION FRANÇAISE

Gouttes de théâtre, qu’est-ce que c’est?

Gouttes de théâtre: le premier festival de théâtre français à Rome!

L’objectif du Festival Gouttes de Théâtre (Gocce di Teatro) est de faire découvrir au public italien la langue et la culture françaises à travers le théâtre sous toutes ses formes. Théâtre classique, opéra, adaptation de la littérature et de la poésie françaises mais aussi théâtre contemporain seront représentés au sein de ce festival.

L’idée est d’amener sur la scène italienne des troupes françaises qui jouent actuellement en France et aussi grâce à cela, d’amener un bout de la culture française en Italie. En choisissant des spectacles qui gardent un lien avec l’Italie ou l’italien,  le pont est ainsi créé entre les deux pays; ces deux cultures qu’on décrit souvent comme cousines.

Cependant, au lieu de concentrer les spectacles sur une courte période comme pour les festivals classiques, il nous est apparu plus intéressant de parsemer la saison théâtrale romaine de nos petites gouttes de théâtre français.

Les spectacles seront en français et sous-titrés en italien.

 

Pour qui?

Pour tous les francophones et les francophiles, pour tous les passionnés de théâtre et pour tous les curieux!

 

Où et quand?

Le Festival aura lieu au Théâtre Vascello à Rome tout au long de la saison théâtrale 2018-2019.

Le théâtre Vascello a été créé il y a presque 30 ans en 1989 par Giancarlo Nanni et Manuela Kustermann. Le théâtre est spécialisé en productions contemporaines et gère un atelier “La Fabbrica dell’attore”.

Aujourd’hui le théâtre est dirigé par Manuela Kustermann, directrice artistique et Marco Ciuti, directeur administratif et compte 360 places.

Plus d’informations => http://teatrovascello.it/sezioni/teatro.htm

Notre première goutte, La Traviata, du Théâtre des Bouffes du Nord, se tiendra les 6 et 7 octobre.

 

Notre première goutte: La Traviata du Théâtre des Bouffes du Nord 

Le spectacle est une adaptation du célèbre opéra de Giuseppe Verdi, lui même inspiré par La Dame aux Camélias de Dumas fils qu’il écrivit après sa tragique relation avec la courtisane Marie Duplessis. Violetta, courtisane parisienne en vue et Alfredo, jeune bourgeois provençal, tombent éperdument amoureux. Violetta renonce à sa vie mondaine, mais le père d’Alfredo la contraint à rompre.

La Traviata, issue d'un roman d'un auteur français adapté à l'opéra par un compositeur Italien,  transformée en une pièce de théâtre en France, revient en Italie à Rome pour le festival Gouttes de théâtre. Le Théâtre des Bouffes du Nord, compagnie française parisienne de renom, vous présente Traviata- Vous méritez un avenir meilleur, sa première représentation en tournée de la saison.

Le Théâtre des Bouffes du Nord en parle:

“Dans Traviata - Vous méritez un avenir meilleur, les spectateurs sont invités dans l'intimité de Violetta à voir de tout près le feu auquel elle se livre, parmi les convives de cette fête musicale et fantasmagorique où se mêlent théâtre et opéra, voix parlées et voix chantées, où la distinction entre instrumentistes et chanteurs se brouille, où Charles Baudelaire se trouve assis près de Christophe Tarkos et où chantent et meurent les fantômes de ce Paris en plein essor industriel dont nous vivons à présent l'avenir.” http://www.bouffesdunord.com/traviata

 

Le Crowdfunding: A quoi serviront les fonds récoltés

A faire venir la célèbre compagnie des Bouffes du Nord à Rome:

  • Troupe: 21 acteurs, musiciens et techniciens
  • Organisation logistique: Transport et logement des Bouffes du Nord
  • Communication et publicité: Supports papier et numériques, affichage public, insertions-presse

 

Et les autres gouttes?

Après le Théâtre des Bouffes du Nord, la Compagnie Française de Théâtre de Rome accueillera au cours de la saison 2018-2019 au Vascello d’autres compagnies et leurs spectacles:

  • Les Fourberies de Scapin, de la Compagnie Théâtre du Kronope https://www.kronope.com/tout-public/les-fourber...
  • Antigone de la Compagnie La Naïve https://lanaive.fr/antigone/
  • Le Misanthrope de la Compagnie Acquaviva https://www.cieacquaviva.fr/misanthrope
  • Le Troisième Etage de la Compagnie Française de Théâtre de Rome
  • Tout Pour Etre Heureux de Christian Poissonneau

 

La Compagnie et ses activités

L’actrice et metteur en scène Hélène Sandoval a été formée au Conservatoire d’Art Dramatique de Grenoble, puis à la Scuola d’Arte Drammatica Silvio d’Amico, lors de son arrivée à Rome en 1995. Pendant 10 ans, elle a fait partie de compagnies italiennes et a joué dans des théâtres romains réputés : Teatro Eliseo, Teatro dei Satiri, Teatro della Bugia, Teatro Quirino, Teatro Ambra Jovinelli avant de créer sa propre compagnie.

C’est ainsi que naît le Théâtre Français de Rome en 2003. Il comprend la Compagnie Française de Théâtre de Rome, une compagnie de théâtre professionnelle basée à Rome qui a la particularité d’être composée uniquement d’acteurs francophones et propose cours et spectacles.

Depuis 15 ans, le Théâtre Français de Rome promeut ainsi la culture et la langue françaises à travers des auteurs français classiques ou contemporains.

Nous collaborons régulièrement avec des institutions locales comme l’Institut Français-Centre Saint Louis, le Convitto Nazionale ou le lycée Chateaubriand, l’Ecole française de Rome.

Nous proposons:

  • Spectacles en langue française en matinée pour les écoles, à Rome et dans toute l’Italie.
  • Spectacles en langue française avec sous-titres italiens pour un public plus large, à Rome et dans toute l’Italie.
  • Cours de théâtre en français auprès des écoles françaises et italiennes, de l’Institut Français de Rome et de notre structure, pour tous les âges (enfants, ados, adultes)
  • Dîners-spectacles bilingues avec sketchs et chansons
  • Ateliers-théâtre et stages d’été en français pour les enfants et ados

Plus d’infos sur la Compagnie => www.teatrofrancese.com

Suivez-nous!

Site internet: www.teatrofrancese.com

Facebook de la Compagnie: https://www.facebook.com/theatrefrancaisrome/

Evénement Gouttes de Théâtre: https://www.facebook.com/events/128851184640465/

Twitter: https://twitter.com/teatrofrancese

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/teatrofrancese/

Newsletter: S’inscrire à info@teatrofrancese.com
story_txt:
Retrouvez la version française ci-dessousGouttes de Théâtre, che cos' è?Gouttes de Théâtre (Gocce di teatro): il primo festival di teatro francese a Roma!L'obiettivo del Festival Gouttes de Théâtre (Gocce di Teatro) è di far scoprire al pubblico italiano la lingua et la cultura francesi tramite il teatro nella sua diversità. Il teatro classico, l’opera, spettacoli ispirati dalla letteratura e poesia francesi ma anche teatro contemporaneo saranno rappresentati in questo festival.L'idea è di portare sulla scena italiana truppe francesi che sono attualmente in scena in Francia e dunque, portare un pezzo della cultura francese in Italia. Scegliendo spettacoli che mantengono un legame con l'Italia, il ponte viene creato tra i due paesi; tra due culture che sono spesso descritte come cugine.Tuttavia, invece di concentrare gli spettacoli in un breve periodo come per i festival classici, ci è sembrato più interessante cospargere la stagione teatrale romana 2018-2019 con le nostre piccole gocce di teatro francese.Gli spettacoli in lingua francese saranno sottotitolati in italiano.Per chi?Per tutti i francofoni e francofili, per tutti gli amanti del teatro e tutti i curiosi!Dove? Quando?Il festival si svolgerà presso il Teatro Vascello a Roma durante tutta la stagione teatrale 2018-2019.Il Teatro Vascello è stato fondato quasi 30 anni fa da Giancarlo Nanni e Manuela Kustermann nel 1989. Il teatro è specializzato in produzioni contemporanee e gestisce un laboratorio “La Fabbrica dell’attore”.Oggi il teatro è gestito da Manuela Kustermann, direttrice artistica e Marco Ciuti, direttore amministrativo e organizzativo e ha 360 posti.Maggiori informazioni => http://teatrovascello.it/sezioni/teatro.htmLa nostra prima goccia, La Traviata del Théâtre des Bouffes du Nord, si terrà dal 6 al 7 ottobre. La nostra prima goccia: La Traviata del Théâtre des Bouffes du NordLo spettacolo è un adattamento della famosa opera di Giuseppe Verdi, lui stesso ispirato da La Signora delle Camelie da Dumas figlio, che scrisse dopo la sua tragica relazione con la cortigiana Marie Duplessis. Violetta, cortigiana parigina in vista e Alfredo, un giovane borghese provenzale, si amano follemente. Violetta rinuncia alla sua vita mondana, ma il padre di Alfredo la costringe alla rottura.La Traviata è quindi una storia francese, adattata per l'opera da un compositore italiano, poi trasformata in un'opera teatrale in Francia, torna in Italia a Roma per il festival Gocce di teatro. Le Théâtre des Bouffes du Nord, una famosa compagnia francese, presenta Traviata - Ti meriti un futuro migliore , prima in tournée della stagione.Le Théâtre des Bouffes du Nord dice:"Nella Traviata - Ti meriti un futuro migliore, gli spettatori sono invitati nell'intimità di Violetta a vedere da vicino il fuoco in cui è coinvolta, tra gli ospiti di questa festa musicale e fantasmagorica che mescola teatro e opera, voci parlate e voci cantanti, dove la distinzione tra strumentisti e cantanti è confusa, dove Charles Baudelaire siede accanto a Christophe Tarkos e dove muoiono i fantasmi di questa Parigi in piena espansione, di cui ora viviamo il futuro."   http://www.bouffesdunord.com/fr/la-saison/traviata Il crowdfunding: A cosa serviranno i fondi?A portare la famosa Compagnia Théatre des Bouffes du Nord a Roma!

Troupe: 21 attori, musiscisti e tecnici

Organizzazione logistica: Trasporti e alloggi delle Bouffes du Nord

Comunicazione e pubblicità: Supporti cartacei e digitali, elementi graffici web, affissione pubblica,  inserimenti stampa
 E le altre gocce?A seguire le Théâtre des Bouffes du Nord, la Compagnie Française de Théâtre de Rome e il Vascello accoglieranno altre compagnie e i loro spettacoli durante la stagione 2018-2019:

Les Fourberies de Scapin del Théâtre du Kronope https://www.kronope.com/tout-public/les-fourberies-de-scapin/


Antigone della Compagnia La Naïve https://lanaive.fr/antigone/


Le Misanthrope della Compagnia Acquaviva  https://www.cieacquaviva.fr/misanthrope

story:
What is Missed Connections: A Craigslist Musical?

'Craigslist'  is a new original musical out of Canada based on real Craigslist Ads – “Your Personal Ads Set To Music” written by Canadian Humorist Bill Richardson, Indie Folk Artist Veda Hille and Amiel Gladstone. The show features a diverse cast of six actor-musicians; three men and three women. It explores the universal desire for human longing and connection from the perspective of people who post on Craigslist.  It was developed and premiered at the Arts Club Theatre, Vancouver, BC, 2012.  Craigslist was originally produced in a 20 minute version by Theatre Replacement as a co-commission with PuSh and Theatre Conspiracy, Vancouver, BC, 2009.  It has since had productions in Toronto, ON, Calgary, AB, and Edmonton, AB.

From one of the Authors:
"A few years ago, with not much more than fun in mind, we hauled some Craigslist ads free of their moorings. Veda Hille set them to music. With Amiel Gladstone, she put together a cast of Vancouver singing actors and performed the show as a 20-minute musical. It was meant to end there. What we didn’t count on was that, even in that hurried first go-around, we would find the evidence of so much tenderness, folly, and longing. There was more there than we suspected or knew. It was funny, but it was compelling. So, we kept on working, adding, subtracting, rearranging, as one does."- Bill Richardson

Where has Craigslist been?

  • World Premier Arts Club Theatre Company, Vancouver, BC Canada 2012
  • Tour of Lower Mainland BC, Arts Club Theatre Company 2013
  • Acting Up Stage Company and Factory Theatre Co-Production, Toronto, ON 2014*
  • High Performance Rodeo Festival presented by One Yellow Rabbit and Alberta Theatre Project, Calgary, AB 2014*
  • The Citadel Theatre, Edmonton, AB 2014*
  • National Arts Centre, Ottawa, ON 2014*
  • 29 Hour Reading-Shetler Studios, New York, NY, April 2015 Playbill Press Release, Broadway World Press Release
  • Backer's Reading-The Theatre Center, New York, NY, June 2015

*Acting Up Stage Company and Factory Theatre Production



To hear more music from the show, visit the GALLERY tab at the top of the page.

Reading Rehearsal (L to R): Phillip George, Paul Whitty, Rob Marnell, Dawn Cantwell, and Ryan Vona.


Reading Presentation (L to R); Cameron Barnett, Dan Beegan, Phillip George, Paul Whitty, Rob Marnell, Ryan Vona, and Dawn Cantwell.


Who is the Creative Team behind Craigslist? 

Director: Phillip George Off-Broadway: Shout!, Forbidden Broadway Alive and Kicking, Forbidden Hollywood, Whoop-Dee-Doo (Drama Desk Award, Best Musical Revue), The Road to Qatar (York Theatre Company), Forbidden Broadway Cleans Up Its Act, Forbidden Broadway Strikes Back, Forbidden Broadway 2001: A Spoof Odyssey (Drama Desk Award, Best Musical Revue), The Remarkable Ruth Fields (1993 Bistro Award, Best Musical Best Director), When Pigs Fly (as Assoc. Director to Mark Waldrop), Blackout (Amas), Bring Me a Dwarf, Miss Pretty Hard (Dance Theater Workshop),Forbidden Broadway 1988–93. London: Kean (nominated for Evening Standard Award, Best Musical), Forbidden Broadway (The Albery, West End & Menier Chocolate Factory), Shout!, Frankly Scarlet (co-author with Peter Morris); Listen to the Wind, Much Revue About Nothing, Forbidden Broadway, The Famous Five, The Arcadians, Escape from Pterodactyl Island (1999 Michael Steward Award). Regionally: Forum (5th Ave Theatre, Seattle), Best Little Whorehouse, Footloose, Return to the Forbidden Planet, Annie Get Your Gun, The Secret Garden (Paper Mill). As a playwright he is currently hard at work on Thrilling Pulp!

Choreographer: Richard J. Hinds is currently the Associate Director for Disney's Newsies! (Broadway/National Tour). He was the Associate for Here Lies Love (NYC/London), the Broadway revival of Jekyll and Hyde and Il Divo: A Musical Affair featuring Heather Headley.  Richard's directing/choreography credits include Gateway Playhouse, Ogunquit Playhouse, Flat Rock Playhouse, Capital Repertory Theatre and Kansas City Repertory Theatre. Television credits include Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade, America's Got Talent, The Bethenny Show and Good Afternoon America (featuring Liza Minnelli).  Richard has been the Associate on 9 to 5 (National/UK Tour), Disney's High School Musical (National/International Tours), Up Here, Come From Away (La Jolla Playhouse), A Christmas Story (Kansas City Repertory Theatre/5th Ave Theatre), The Last Goodbye, The First Wives Club (The Old Globe), Pippin (CTG and Deaf West), A Wonderful Life (Paper Mill Playhouse), and Samsung Unpacked (Radio City Music Hall). www.richardjhinds.com.

Playwright/Composer: Veda Hille has been writing songs, making records and playing shows all over since 1992. She has released 14 albums, all available through her website: vedahille.com. You can also keep track of her various projects there: rock songs for children, an opera about pine trees, complaints choirs, a reworking of a Tchaikovsky opera, and of course always a new record and show coming soon.

Playwright: Amiel Gladstone is a West Coast-based writer and director. As a director, his productions have been both site-specific in unusual venues and in traditional theatres including numerous world premieres for companies such as Alberta Theatre Projects, Acting Up Stage Company, Arts Club Theatre Company, Belfry Theatre, Caravan Farm Theatre, Factory Theatre, PuSh International Performing Arts Festival, Pacific Opera Victoria, Theatre SKAM, Theatre Replacement, Touchstone Theatre, Vancouver Playhouse and Vancouver Opera. As a playwright, his plays have been produced by the National Arts Centre, Alberta Theatre Projects, the Belfy Theatre, Touchstone Theatre, Caravan Farm Theatre, Solo Collective, Western Edge Theatre, and Theatre SKAM.

Playwright: Bill Richardson is a writer and broadcaster. His books include Bachelor Brothers’ Bed and Breakfast, winner of the Stephen Leacock Medal for Humor, and After Hamelin, a novel for children that won the Silver Birch Award. His radio documentaries have twice been award winners at the New York Radio Festival. House of Anansi will publish his new book, “The First Little Bastard To Call Me Gramps,” in the fall of 2015. He lives in Vancouver, B.C. (population 605,000) and Holmfield, Manitoba (population 14).

Join Our Team

CRAIGSLIST is ready for a production in New York City. The show has had successful readings in NYC, and workshops and productions at prestigious regional theatres throughout Canada. Now due to the show's success and popularity, we are preparing the show for an Off-Broadway Production. First, we need to "showcase it."

WHAT WE NEED NOW IS YOUR GENEROUS FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO GET THIS PROJECT ROLLING.  YOUR CONTRIBUTION WILL GO TOWARDS HIRING A CAST AND CREATIVE TEAM, AND RENTING A THEATRE FOR THE 4 WEEK SHOWCASE.

This your chance to be a part of the show's further development.  To show our appreciation for your support, we have come up with some really awesome rewards for your contribution that will make you part of the CRAIGSLIST family.

Spread the Word

Please help us go viral with this campaign by spreading the word about this awesome new musical via email, Facebook, Twitter, good ol' word of mouth, text and picking up the phone. Post this campaign on your social media sites. Email a campaign link to your friends!  We greatly appreciate YOUR help. Thank you!!!

Hitting our goal: We will be able to produce our intended showcase premiere of Missed Connections in the Theatre District in New York City Spring 2016.

Exceeding our goal: Missed Connections will have an even more outstanding production with higher quality design in sets, lights and costumes. 

Doubling our goal: The show will have increased marketing resources to spread the word on this great show! 

Click the GALLERY LINK above......

To check out an interview with some of the creatives and cast from the Acting Up Stage/Factory Theatre Production in Toronto, ON.

Also watch a performance of a song performed at the the Canadian Musical Theatre Writer's Collective and listen to some tracks from the show performed by the composer. They are just demos but will give you an idea of the diverse musical styles in the show.
story_txt:
What is Missed Connections: A Craigslist Musical? 'Craigslist'  is a new original musical out of Canada based on real Craigslist Ads – “Your Personal Ads Set To Music” written by Canadian Humorist Bill Richardson, Indie Folk Artist Veda Hille and Amiel Gladstone. The show features a diverse cast of six actor-musicians; three men and three women. It explores the universal desire for human longing and connection from the perspective of people who post on Craigslist.  It was developed and premiered at the Arts Club Theatre, Vancouver, BC, 2012.  Craigslist was originally produced in a 20 minute version by Theatre Replacement as a co-commission with PuSh and Theatre Conspiracy, Vancouver, BC, 2009.  It has since had productions in Toronto, ON, Calgary, AB, and Edmonton, AB.
From one of the Authors:"A few years ago, with not much more than fun in mind, we hauled some Craigslist ads free of their moorings. Veda Hille set them to music. With Amiel Gladstone, she put together a cast of Vancouver singing actors and performed the show as a 20-minute musical. It was meant to end there. What we didn’t count on was that, even in that hurried first go-around, we would find the evidence of so much tenderness, folly, and longing. There was more there than we suspected or knew. It was funny, but it was compelling. So, we kept on working, adding, subtracting, rearranging, as one does."- Bill Richardson   Where has Craigslist been?

Canada 2012


Tour of Lower Mainland BC, Arts Club Theatre Company 2013

Reading Presentation (L to R); Cameron Barnett, Dan Beegan, Phillip George, Paul Whitty, Rob Marnell, Ryan Vona, and Dawn Cantwell.

Director to Mark Waldrop), Blackout (Amas), Bring Me a Dwarf, Miss Pretty Hard (Dance Theater Workshop),Forbidden Broadway 1988–93. London: Kean (nominated for Evening Standard Award, Best Musical), Forbidden Broadway (The Albery, West End & Menier Chocolate Factory), Shout!, Frankly Scarlet (co-author with Peter Morris); Listen to the Wind, Much Revue About Nothing, Forbidden Broadway, The Famous Five, The Arcadians, Escape from Pterodactyl Island (1999 Michael Steward Award). Regionally: Forum (5th Ave Theatre, Seattle), Best Little Whorehouse, Footloose, Return to the Forbidden Planet, Annie Get Your Gun, The Secret Garden (Paper Mill). As a playwright he is currently hard at work on Thrilling Pulp!


Choreographer: Richard J. Hinds is currently the Associate Director for Disney's Newsies! (Broadway/National Tour). He was the Associate for Here Lies Love (NYC/London), the Broadway revival of Jekyll and Hyde and Il Divo: A Musical Affair featuring Heather Headley.  Richard's directing/choreography credits include Gateway Playhouse, Ogunquit Playhouse, Flat Rock Playhouse, Capital Repertory Theatre and Kansas City Repertory Theatre. Television credits include Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade, America's Got Talent, The Bethenny Show and Good Afternoon America (featuring Liza Minnelli).  Richard has been the Associate on 9 to 5 (National/UK Tour), Disney's High School Musical (National/International Tours), Up Here, Come From Away (La Jolla Playhouse), A Christmas Story (Kansas City Repertory Theatre/5th Ave Theatre), The Last Goodbye, The First Wives Club (The Old Globe), Pippin (CTG and Deaf West), A Wonderful Life (Paper Mill Playhouse), and Samsung Unpacked (Radio City Music Hall). www.richardjhinds.com.

You can also keep track of her various projects there: rock songs for children, an opera about pine trees, complaints choirs, a reworking of a Tchaikovsky opera, and of course always a new record and show coming soon.

story:
First and Foremost, Our Website:

www.thecatladyplay.com

About the Writers and the Play:

The inception of The Cat Lady Play began in the Fall of 2015 when Markuz and I got together for the first time in nearly 15 years. We'd been good friends in high school with Markuz acting in the school plays and me having written a couple of the scripts. So, it felt like fate when we were together again as friends and the creative spark ignited into a serendipitous surprise. The Cat Lady was born from the most raucous muses in the cosmos of our minds. The full-length play about a 30-something cat lady's quest to pay rent and find love is laugh-out-loud funny, charming, and even romantic.

I, David Vaughn, am a professional humor writer based in San Diego. I've contributed to the Huffington Post and am the author of the middle-grade fantasy book, The Midnight Glass. My other plays include Bird in the Mirror (2002) and How to Make Money at a Lemonade Stand (2001).

Markuz Rodriguez is a professional actor based in San Diego. He has performed at San Diego's famous The Old Globe Theatre, The La Jolla Playhouse, The Diversionary Theatre, and the acclaimed PUNKS at the Ion Theatre. Mr. Rodriguez was selected as a contestant for the reality series, Studio 4.

Combining our talents has been overwhelmingly fun and inspiring. This play is a HUGE dream of ours! We deeply care about this characters and we need help bringing it to the stage.

What We Need

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • The theatre rental for 8 shows August 3 - 12, 2017 at the Tenth Avenue Theatre in downtown San Diego
  • Paying the lead and supporting actors, the crew, rehearsal spaces, and funding the set pieces
  • Advertisements needed to spread the word and help fill the seats to pay for the rest of this project!

What You Get

Essentially what we're doing is a pre-sale of our tickets. We would do the normal pre-sale on our site, but the buzz, at the moment, isn't high enough. This campaign is designed to create excitement and to give you a reason to want to watch this play! We'll post updates as we cast out actors and fun tidbits to show you how truly exciting this production will be to watch.

  • Every contribution comes with one or more tickets. When the campaign has concluded, you will be offered a choice of night, and the tickets will be held at Will Call for you.
  • If you can't make the show, but want to contribute, there are options to donate student tickets. These greatly help with college students on budget who crave local arts.
  • Businesses, please advertise with us! Your ad will appear in our program and a banner under "sponsored" our website's front page!
  • Like VIP? We have you covered! Get an exclusive package with premier seats, behind-the-scenes glimpses, and a meet-and-greet with the actors and playwrights before the show!

The Impact

With films making astronomical sales worldwide, we want to show viewers that the theatre is just as exciting – if not ever more so! The venue is reserved, the dates are set, and we'll soon begin the casting process. Thus, we need the funds by mid-May 2017 in order to start rehearsals. The funds raised here will only cover about half of the costs. The rest we hope to make up in ticket sales, and if we can exceed our current IndieGoGo Goal.

Risks & Challenges

The show is happening! Our main objective is to fill the seats, have fantastic sets, and the ability to pay the lead and supporting actors what they deserve. Without hitting our goal, all of this will be at risk.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean that you can't help:

  • Personally send this to a family member or friend who would enjoy The Cat Lady
  • Post our link on Facebook
  • Like us! Facebook.com/TheCatLadyPlay

Thank You!

Markuz and I are extremely thankful for your consideration and so are the actors soon to be involved in the play. For we who have the hunger to create and perform, your support means the world to us!

Thank you for reading and we hope very much to see you at the show!

story:
Short Summary

  • This is by far the biggest thing that any of us have ever tried to accomplish. We worked without rest for 8 weeks to put this production on in a warehouse/gallery space in Bushwick, Brooklyn last Fall. After rave reviews and a rapidly growing audience we are now jumping onto the Off-Broadway circuit at The Kraine Theatre in Manhattan.
  • Manhattan is very expensive and productions are very expensive, but we have a story we need to share with the world, and it can happen with support from all of you!

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • For this to work we need 52,900 dollars. As we all know, it isn’t cheap to rent a theatre in New York City. And living here isn’t easy either, so we need to pay our actors and crew as well. Plus of course the costs of costumes, props, and everything else. 

     

    According to Actor’s Equity guidelines and our best estimations. This is the breakdown of money that we need to raise:

     

    Theatre Rental for 4 weeks: 10,800

    12 Actors under AEA for 4 weeks: 24,000

    3 musicians for 4 weeks: 6,000

    Crew for 4 weeks: 5,600

    Stage Manager: 2,600

    Advertising: 3,500

    Program costs: 2,000

    Costumes and Props: 2,000

     

     

    This is a potentially world changing project. Your support will be greatly appreciated and I will give all donors an extra shout out in our program (along with whatever perk you choose.) 

  • We have all kinds of perks for those of you who donate! We have Original Cast Recordings, we have posters and t-shirts, we have free tickets, and we have even fancier prizes for the big spenders!

The Impact

  • Everyone who saw our Bushwick, Brooklyn run of the production last year agrees that this is a production that needs to be shared with the world.  
  • Our first run started out with a lot of empty seats and ended with three nights of a packed house in a row. This is in a neighborhood where people don't usually like theatre... or anything, really.

Risks & Challenges

  • We understand that we're asking for a lot for an art form that some people would say is on the decline, but we truly believe that what we have here is worth the risk. 
  • With the help of people like you, we CAN do this. And we will.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't donate money, but live in the New York City area (especially in the East Village) we'd love to have your help with getting the word out!
  • If you don't live in New York, feel free to share this with anyone you know who might be interested!

story:
'Anatomy of the Heart' 

"Joss Carter is a master, a visionary, and a true fine artist"  - Ken Ludden, The Huffington Post

Firstly, I would like to say a huge heartfelt thank you to all the 24 backers who contributed to the first campaign. With your help I was able to raise £1,083 of the £1,900 target. Your generous support has allowed me thus far to get everything in order and prepared until now. (if you would like to see the last campaign please visit www.igg.me/at/aoth2)

With the premiere of ‘Anatomy of the Heart’ looming like a dark cloud over my head I still have a lot more work to do!   Problems to solve, performance to finish, people to pay, money to raise, risks to assess & tickets to sell. 

Talking of tickets……….I have a number of exclusive tickets on offer for the premiere on the 20th February 2018, at The Place, 17 Duke's Road, London, WC1H 9PY

Book your PREMIERE TICKET through me and I’ll do all the hassle for you, Just turn up to The Place, 17 Duke’s Road, London, WC1H 9PY before 7:45PM on the 20th February 2018, and I will meet and greet you in the bar with a package including your ticket, other exclusive items available below, and a glass of fizz (and more drinks tokens for later).

As the joys and sorrows of Valantines will still linger like a bad smell and if you want to treat you and your loved one to a night at the theatre for a belated date night….. Get two tickets to the premiere of 'Anatomy of the Heart' with the VALENTINES SPECIAL PREMIERE TICKET.

If you cannot make the premiere performance evening but would still like to come and see the show before anyone else gets to….travel yourself up to my very own studio in North London on Sunday 18th Feb for an EXCLUSIVE REHEARSAL, behind the scenes gossip, and the final dress run before the big day. Time TBC.

If you can’t, or don’t want to come and see the show at all but still want to support you can get yourselves a number of items including: 

a personalised SHOUT OUT and thank you on social media, and credit on all digital and printed content.

If you would like to hear me scream sweet nothings into your ears….get the exclusive .MP3 digital download of the song ‘LOVESICK’, written and performed by myself, produced, mixed and mastered by musical collaborator Kit Bodenham.

If something a little more personal is your kinda thing, get yourself the MEMENTO letter written on a flyer.

The A5 printed HEAVY HEART ILLUSTRATION is perfect as a small gift to yourself or a loved one.

Wanna make a statement? Then the HEAVY HEART TEE SHIRT is just for you!

Want to piss off your parents? Get HEAVY HEART TATTOO ; )

If your just a kind and generous human being and want to contribute without wanting something in return than thats also possible…OR… if you can’t or don’t want to support financially at all thats completely fine too….Sharing links and information on social media doesn’t cost a thing and only takes 3 clicks of a finger.

So what is ‘Anatomy of the Heart’ and what’s it about?

Watch the first crowdfunding campaign video here!

Have you ever felt physically love sick, or just mentally sick of love?

‘AotH’ is my forth contemporary dance theatre and live art solo. Kindly supported by Sadler’s Wells Theatre, The Place, K5 Studio and TripDance along with all the crowdfunding bodies from the last campaign (see names below), "this cruel solo pursuit dissects the grotesque self conscious, anxious confessions of a romantically melancholic soul (me). Confronting the realms between dance theatre and live performance art, I aim to strip my ego to its core evoking the depressive methods of my madness within personal encounters/experiences of love and mental health. With a stage drenched in sadness I will slip, slide and suspend in a world of shame with the hope of unearthing once more the empathetic archeology of humanity.

Aiming to bring further awareness and understanding of the stigma that entwines the conceptual abstraction into the fundamental issues of reality and exsistence, this improvisational composition interrogates deepest, darkest intimacies guided by personal writing, an unsystematic inventory of broken metaphors and similies, and breathtaking imagery. ‘Anatomy of the Heart’ is a poetical hallucination of intangible delerium that is forever changing like the weather of consciouness."

WARNING: This piece contains nudity and graphic imagery which some audiences may find offensive and/or traumatic.

Personal Note: If you have been, or know of anyone suffering from mental health issues please remember that friends, family, the NHS, and other support groups are there to discuss any issues you may be suffering from. For more information on how you can help yourself or someone else please visit: www.NHS.uk or www.mind.org.uk

Many of you looking at this would have been following, or seen my work before in one way or another, so it comes as no surprise that this performance will be extreme and challenging to both you the audience, and I on many levels. If you are not familiar with my work please check out my website www.JossCarter.co.uk or read a short biography within my campaign profile.

'Anatomy of the Heart' will premiere at The Place, 17 Dukes Road, London, WC15 9PY on 20th February 2018 at 8pm as part of a triple bill of works during 'Resolution' Choreographic Platform.

RRP tickets £16/£12 concessions are available to book through:

The Place box office - 020 7121 1100

or online www.theplace.org.uk/whats-on/out-order-sara-augieras-joss-carter

Company and Collaborator credits:

Conceptualised/Performed by: Joss Carter (www.josscarter.co.uk)
Producer: Joss Carter
Photography: Dean Chalkley (www.deanchalkley.com)
Cinematography: Daniel Lowenstein (www.lowensteinphotofilm.com) // Yi Zhang (www.ezhang.today)    
Musical producer: Kit Bodenham (www.soundcloud.com/k80_8)
Special FX: Karolina Kluzniak (www.karolinakluzniak.com)
Aerial Rigging: Aaron Marshall
Joss Carter Company Stage Manager: Kip Johnson

Special thanks to: Sadler's Wells Theatre, Tripspace Projects, K5 Studio, The Place, Dean Chalkley, Dan Lowenstein, Yi Zhang, Kit Bodenham, Karolina Kluzniak, Kip Johnson, Aaron Marshall, Robyn Cabaret, Lee Clayden, Jerrel Jackson, Brita Grov, Miss Anonymous, Kiran Chahal, Peter Leach, Nicolas Vendange, Laura Patay, Bella Whatley, Jackie Hindson, Nathanial Wadey, Daniel Hernandez, Heather Albrighton, Mr Anonymous, Maria Lothe, Alistair Goldsmith, Laura Weston, Miss Anonymous, Lisa Clarke, Rudi Cole, Connor Quill, Montserrat Ventura, Gary Clarke, Claire Hale, Mr Anonymous, Ken Ludden.
story_txt: 'Anatomy of the Heart' "Joss Carter is a master, a visionary, and a true fine artist"  - Ken Ludden, The Huffington PostFirstly, I would like to say a huge heartfelt thank you to all the 24 backers who contributed to the first campaign. With your help I was able to raise £1,083 of the £1,900 target. Your generous support has allowed me thus far to get everything in order and prepared until now. (if you would like to see the last campaign please visit www.igg.me/at/aoth2)With the premiere of ‘Anatomy of the Heart’ looming like a dark cloud over my head I still have a lot more work to do!   Problems to solve, performance to finish, people to pay, money to raise, risks to assess & tickets to sell. Talking of tickets……….I have a number of exclusive tickets on offer for the premiere on the 20th February 2018, at The Place, 17 Duke's Road, London, WC1H 9PYBook your PREMIERE TICKET through me and I’ll do all the hassle for you, Just turn up to The Place, 17 Duke’s Road, London, WC1H 9PY before 7:45PM on the 20th February 2018, and I will meet and greet you in the bar with a package including your ticket, other exclusive items available below, and a glass of fizz (and more drinks tokens for later).As the joys and sorrows of Valantines will still linger like a bad smell and if you want to treat you and your loved one to a night at the theatre for a belated date night….. Get two tickets to the premiere of 'Anatomy of the Heart' with the VALENTINES SPECIAL PREMIERE TICKET.If you cannot make the premiere performance evening but would still like to come and see the show before anyone else gets to….travel yourself up to my very own studio in North London on Sunday 18th Feb for an EXCLUSIVE REHEARSAL, behind the scenes gossip, and the final dress run before the big day. Time TBC.If you can’t, or don’t want to come and see the show at all but still want to support you can get yourselves a number of items including: a personalised SHOUT OUT and thank you on social media, and credit on all digital and printed content.If you would like to hear me scream sweet nothings into your ears….get the exclusive .MP3 digital download of the song ‘LOVESICK’, written and performed by myself, produced, mixed and mastered by musical collaborator Kit Bodenham.If something a little more personal is your kinda thing, get yourself the MEMENTO letter written on a flyer.The A5 printed HEAVY HEART ILLUSTRATION is perfect as a small gift to yourself or a loved one.Wanna make a statement? Then the HEAVY HEART TEE SHIRT is just for you!Want to piss off your parents? Get HEAVY HEART TATTOO ; )If your just a kind and generous human being and want to contribute without wanting something in return than thats also possible…OR… if you can’t or don’t want to support financially at all thats completely fine too….Sharing links and information on social media doesn’t cost a thing and only takes 3 clicks of a finger.So what is ‘Anatomy of the Heart’ and what’s it about?Watch the first crowdfunding campaign video here!Have you ever felt physically love sick, or just mentally sick of love?‘AotH’ is my forth contemporary dance theatre and live art solo. Kindly supported by Sadler’s Wells Theatre, The Place, K5 Studio and TripDance along with all the crowdfunding bodies from the last campaign (see names below), "this cruel solo pursuit dissects the grotesque self conscious, anxious confessions of a romantically melancholic soul (me). Confronting the realms between dance theatre and live performance art, I aim to strip my ego to its core evoking the depressive methods of my madness within personal encounters/experiences of love and mental health. With a stage drenched in sadness I will slip, slide and suspend in a world of shame with the hope of unearthing once more the empathetic archeology of humanity.Aiming to bring further awareness and understanding of the stigma that entwines the conceptual abstraction into the fundamental issues of reality and exsistence, this improvisational composition interrogates deepest, darkest intimacies guided by personal writing, an unsystematic inventory of broken metaphors and similies, and breathtaking imagery. ‘Anatomy of the Heart’ is a poetical hallucination of intangible delerium that is forever changing like the weather of consciouness."WARNING: This piece contains nudity and graphic imagery which some audiences may find offensive and/or traumatic.Personal Note: If you have been, or know of anyone suffering from mental health issues please remember that friends, family, the NHS, and other support groups are there to discuss any issues you may be suffering from. For more information on how you can help yourself or someone else please visit: www.NHS.uk or www.mind.org.ukMany of you looking at this would have been following, or seen my work before in one way or another, so it comes as no surprise that this performance will be extreme and challenging to both you the audience, and I on many levels. If you are not familiar with my work please check out my website www.JossCarter.co.uk or read a short biography within my campaign profile.'Anatomy of the Heart' will premiere at The Place, 17 Dukes Road, London, WC15 9PY on 20th February 2018 at 8pm as part of a triple bill of works during 'Resolution' Choreographic Platform.RRP tickets £16/£12 concessions are available to book through:The Place box office - 020 7121 1100or online www.theplace.org.uk/whats-on/out-order-sara-augieras-joss-carterCompany and Collaborator credits:Conceptualised/Performed by: Joss Carter (www.josscarter.co.uk)Producer: Joss CarterPhotography: Dean Chalkley (www.deanchalkley.com)Cinematography: Daniel Lowenstein (www.lowensteinphotofilm.com) // Yi Zhang (www.ezhang.today)    Musical producer: Kit Bodenham (www.soundcloud.com/k80_8)Special FX: Karolina Kluzniak (www.karolinakluzniak.com)Aerial Rigging: Aaron MarshallJoss Carter Company Stage Manager: Kip JohnsonSpecial thanks to: Sadler's Wells Theatre, Tripspace Projects, K5 Studio, The Place, Dean Chalkley, Dan Lowenstein, Yi Zhang, Kit Bodenham, Karolina Kluzniak, Kip Johnson, Aaron Marshall, Robyn Cabaret, Lee Clayden, Jerrel Jackson, Brita Grov, Miss Anonymous, Kiran Chahal, Peter Leach, Nicolas Vendange, Laura Patay, Bella Whatley, Jackie Hindson, Nathanial Wadey, Daniel Hernandez, Heather Albrighton, Mr Anonymous, Maria Lothe, Alistair Goldsmith, Laura Weston, Miss Anonymous, Lisa Clarke, Rudi Cole, Connor Quill, Montserrat Ventura, Gary Clarke, Claire Hale, Mr Anonymous, Ken Ludden.

story:
A few words about us.

Our university's drama club was founded in 2006. It consists of university student only, each one passing his knowledge to the others. No special instructors, no experts and no funding from the University. 

While participating in the cultural week of the University of the Aegean, our first performance took place in 2008, with Jean-Paul Sartre's work. The next year, we took part in the REACT FESTIVAL with a short performance. 2011 was the year that we participated in the 8th Festival for University Drama Clubs in Greece. What followed was the performance of a theatrical play of Sergey Belbel, in the Apollon Theater of Syros, in 2012. In 2013, we produced the play "Bad Santa" in the 10th Festival for University Drama Clubs in Greece, that took place in the city of Chania and was performed 2 more times on the Apollon Theater's stage. In 2014, we produced the play "Blackout", also performed in the Apollon stage and in 2015 the play called "Rinokeros". In 2016 we put on stage " Our favorite coworker and friend" and in 2017, Shakespeare's play "Midnight summers dream".

Every year, our group is open to anyone who wants to become a member of our club. With exercises that boost our improvisation, expression and speech skills, we learn how to express ourselves and open up to others more easily. Also, throughout the year we are proud to create everything that is necessary, from our props and costumes to our posters, all by ourselves.

About our latest production.

For the very first year, we are experimenting with new types of theater production, such as a musical. We are aware of the difficulties, but our passion and excitement exceed them! Our play is called "Make Belief" and it is a different take on the Peter Pan stories, all translated from other plays and musicals and made into one beautiful story. We believe that with hard work anything can be achieved and that financial restrictions should not be a hindrance to our dreams. With up to 40 members in our group, the costumes that need to be sawn are numerous. Additionally, the set necessities are many and tech support is mandatory. No matter how small, every contribution counts. 

Thank you in advance!

All funds go to fabrics, wood planks and other raw materials for our costumes, props and set.

*Any amount above 2€ will receive a PDF version of our Poster, as a thank you!

story:
Short Summary

We are Theatre6 and Tales Retold. Two successful touring companies coming together to create a radical new adaptation of Charles Dickens' 'Great Expectations'.

This show is a dynamic new version of a classic novel, performed by three actor musicians and featuring an original score by Maria Haik Escudero.

We are committed to making theatre work that gives space to unheard stories and brave new ideas. We are also passionate about the sustainability and accessibility of our shows. We believe these two things are the future. 

We are proud that this production supports an all female producing and core creative team. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise £4000 through this campaign to fund the essential elements of this production. 

We are offering a range of rewards including A3 show posters signed by the whole company, a vintage style copy of the original book (with a secret note to you inside!) and an official "thank you" across our social media platforms and websites. 

The contributions you make will assist us with design materials, costume, props and cast and creative wages to make this show. 

 

The Future of Theatre!

Your contribution will make such a huge difference to us during a very tricky time for everyone -  especially the creative industries. 

You will be helping us to tour ground breaking theatre around the UK, which will be joyful and entertaining for people to see safely outdoors and indoors. We feel strongly about the importance of re-imagining classic stories for the next generation of theatre goers.  

We have a very successful track record with touring projects, Theatre 6 - 'Persuasion' (UK tour), 'Gabriel' (UK tour) and 'Tales Retold' (Uncle Vanya, Antigone).

We are excited to build long lasting relationships with contributors by staying in touch and involving them in the development of our companies and our shows. 

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk we are facing is our performances being affected due to extreme weather and COVID restrictions.

We will be keeping all audience and staff safe at our venues in line with government guidelines using hand sanitiser, face coverings and social distanced seating.

We are performing Estella in both indoor and outdoor venues during the summer. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You may not be able to contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help us spread the word:

- Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

- Use the Indiegogo share tools and reshare our posts on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram @TalesRetold @Theatre6!

- Come and see 'Estella' on tour at one of our venues in the summer at Brighton Open Air Theatre, The Omnibus Theatre in Clapham and Riverhouse Barn in Walton-upon-Thames. 

Thank you for reading our campaign and we hope to see you this summer!

story:
Who Are We?

The Women's Theatre Festival (WTF) is a group of theatre artists, both women and allies, who seek to address gender parity, diversity, & inclusion in the theatre community. Our mission is to create, produce, and promote extraordinary theatre by women by:

Producing a festival every summer where all shows are:
1. Written by playwrights who identify as female or non-binary. 

2018: Crumble (Lay Me Down, Justin Timberlake) by Sheila Callaghan, Parallel Lives by Mo Gaffney and Kathy Najimy, Goblin Market by Polly Pen and Christina Rossetti, Eclipsed by Danai Gurira & These Shining Lives by Melanie Marnich

2. Have a cast makeup of 50% women or higher. 2018 - DONE!

3. Have at least 50% of the roles open to actors who are people of color. 2018 - Casting still in process, but moving toward the goal quickly!

In addition to our mainstage shows, we host workshops, classes, panel discussions, produce a 24-hour play festival (Occupy the Stage), and are developing year-round programming. WTF is a force in the community and hopes to inspire change in the triangle so that theatre programming is 50/50 by 2020 across the board.

What Are We Doing?

WTF is launching our 3rd annual season of extraordinary theatre by women in the Triangle with our 2018 theme being Women Are Heroes. We create great theatre, provide opportunities, and we are a leader in the shift of better gender representation in our theatrical community.

Why Should You Be a Member?

A Membership to the WTF community not only means that you’re helping us mount remarkable shows, but you’ll help shift the mindset of what truly diverse theatre can do. Our 2018 Membership program also has a lot more to offer this year. Keep reading to see how we intend to reward our members this year.

What Can We Offer You?

In the past, membership to WTF meant paying $5 in dues and, in exchange, you got the right to vote on the shows you’d like to see us produce. Our membership team has been reaching out and listening to you. What we’ve heard is that you want more out of your membership--more opportunities for meaningful engagement, more involvement, more connection, more pathways for growth, and more communication.

With our new Tiered Membership Program, we think we’ve got you covered! You’ll still have the option of paying just $5 for your annual dues for voting privileges, but we’ve loaded every level with perks, privileges, and special opportunities!

$5 Value Membership

  • Voting rights
  • Members Only Newsletter
  • Exclusive Members Only Button*
  • Name in Season Program

$30 Basic Membership

  • Everything in Value Membership
  • Access to Members Only Events and Special Events
  • Early Bird Ticket Sales
  • Priority Access to all Audition Slots
  • 1 Complimentary  Workshop Pass

Supportive Sidekick $50

  • Everything in the Basic Membership Package
  • Choice of Members-Only or Season T-shirt

Everyday Hero $75

  • Everything in the Basic Membership Package
  • 1 Season Ticket all 5 Mainstage 2018 Festival Shows
  • 1 Admission to Occupy The Stage: OccupyCon2018

Action Hero $150

  • Everything in the Everyday Hero Tier
  • Stage: OccupyCon2018
  • Early Access to all ticket sales including Special Events
  • Choice of Members-Only or Season T-Shirt

Hero for The Ages $250

  • Everything in the Action Hero Tier
  • VIP Early Preferred Seating Access
  • VIP Seating at Tonys Awards Gala
  • Special Donors Dinner

Super Hero $500

  • Everything in the Hero For The Ages Tier
  • 2 season tickets (instead of just one)
  • Exclusive autographed poster and program from Crumble

Wonder Women+ $1000

  • Everything in the Super Hero Tier
  • Super special artifact from one of the shows and signed poster and program from a show of your choice
  • Backstage Meet & Greet
  • Special Superhero-themed photoshoot with Ashley Popio

 

*button must be picked up at a WTF event (to save on postage and trees we will not mail); wearing the button will grant access to exclusive discounts (like a discount to purchase member t-shirt, etc) and surprises throughout the season

**season passes are non-transferrable, must pre-register for seats

Want to break up your Membership into a few equal installments? Email us at info@womenstheatrefestival.com to set it up!
 

Can’t become a member now, but want to help us achieve our goals? Shares and RT's are FREE!
